Reviews.Title: “Family Suite”
Reviews.Author: vegas_local_2010
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Cosmpolitan Hotel. We stayed in the Family Suite and it was perfect for our group of 5. We found the staff to be very helpful and hospitable. The location was perfect for seeing the City as the subway stop was literally steps from the Cosmopolitan's entrance. Our room was very clean, quiet, inviting and the price was extremely reasonable. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: Be forwarned thatChambers Street is under construction for blocks. There was deafining construction noise one night that lasted until 2 am. I realize that this isn't the Hotel's fault but if you are a lite sleeper I would suggest another place to stay. the room was small but clean and there is no central air-conditioning. The staff was polite I doubt that I stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very well-priced hotel for the basics, in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Mlindzy
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, cozy hotel with a great location in Tribeca. It is very European-styled, and you will see many Europeans staying here due to that spartan style and very reasonable rates. You should know that the rooms are small (ours was 12x15ft) with only basic amenities. Ours had 2 double beds, so no room for a chair. There is a small closet/dresser and a nightstand only. The bathroom is small as well, with enough room to turn around in. If you are a person who travels and needs to exercise, be warned that there is NO FITNESS ROOM and not even enough space in the room to do basic exercises. There is a subway station directly in front, which is very convenient but also a bit noisy. The staff is very friendly and warm, which is always appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan Hotel - NYC”
Reviews.Author: eciarma
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow business travelers, If you're looking for a relatively inexpensive place to stay in the Financial District of NYC, this hotel is certainly great as far as price is concerned. Be forewarned, though, that the hotel is one of the oldest in NYC. It's obvious when you find out that all rooms are centrally controlled with no temperature gauges and the majority of the rooms DO NOT have AC controls. If you don't mind being in a hot, tiny, stuffy room, where the carpets on each floor smell like mildew, then this is the place to stay. The Reception desk on the main floor is also tiny, usually congested with line-ups of people (especially on Friday checkouts) and the ONE elevator (that holds a maximum of six people at a time) is completely unreliable. I ended up having to climb six very old flights of stairs on three out of my five days of stay. Although my room was comfortable and clean (after I ended up switching to a room with working AC), and the staff was as helpful as they could be, this is still a very OLD hotel - and that becomes quite obvious when you first see the hotel's front door entrance (you'd miss it if you really weren't paying attention). The lobby is also very drab (pale yellow) and could seriously use some artwork or color. If you're used to staying at the Marriott (like me) or other comparable hotels, spend the extra $100 and stay at a fully functional hotel. This one's great budget wise, but I'll probably never stay there again. On a positive note, there were no bed bugs! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: eyeful11
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on one-night stay (live close enough to visit NYC frequently) from being on their mailing list. Winter especially good time for this. This was first time at Cosmopolitan -- loved it. Location is great for downtown exploration - walking distance to WTC Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, SoHo, Battery Park, South Street Seaport, and also to West Village, Chinatown if you like walking. Small, clean, well-appointed room; small, clean bathroom; air shaft view, but who wants to stay in room? Very courteous staff. Had delicious croissant + coffee at adjoining quiet cafe - there's also a lively Starbucks next door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Christyyy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious and the cleaning staff was so on top of things. The front desk staff as well was the friendliest I've ever seen- always willing to answer questions and often went out of their way to help us out. Perfect location as well. Right across the street from three subway lines, and right down the street from another three. Easy walking distance to shopping haven Soho, as well as Chinatown and Little Italy. Tons of nice restaurants within walking distance as well, and a salon right next door with cheap manicure prices! Couldn't have asked for a better hotel- will stay there again next time we go to NYC for sure!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: uss_yorktown
Reviews.Content: Other travellers have already mentionned the qualities of this hotel. Good location, many (cheap) eateries and a few bars close by. Not too expensive. The subway and bus stop right below and nearby. If you want to go uptown take bus 5. If you want to go back then take bus 20. This is only of course if you are not in a hurry, else take a train. The 2 free computers are also excellent. The only downside is that my standard room did not have a mini fridge. I can therefore really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back after spending a great weekend in NYC and a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Cosmpolitan Hotel. I had checked reviews leading up to our arrival in New York and one of the things that impressed me was the hotel's (Rachel) response to many of the comments. I like hotels which take heed of comments and we even followed up ourselves prior to arrival. I requested a quiet room for us and our friends and we were delighted to receive just that. Nothing special in terms of a view, but I don't consider that important in NYC. The room had two queen sized beds and was very comfortable. It's a 3 star hotel and I would say that this was just about right, but the staff work hard and this was an important facet of our stay. Jenny on the reception was especially helpful and friendly. It wasn't not the biggest hotel room I've had, but better than others I've booked in Manhattan. The aircon was very noisy in our room, so we just used it to cool the room down in the morning, but that is the only real complaint I would make. It may be a bigger problem in the summer. A big positive for me was the free wifi. All in all, it was a good choice and we would have no hesitation in going back to the Cosmopolitan again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo home from home”
Reviews.Author: alison l
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in this hotel about six times now and we have stayed in a few others in new york. We love this hotel because it doesn't feel like a big chain type of hotel it is small and personal you can smell the coffee as you walk down the stair well in the morning from starbucks down stairs. Its very well situated with the subway outside your door. We got a deal for the Wall St Andaz in 2011 while very nice its not the Cosmopolitan we have booked the cosmo for sept 2012 will be like being back home again. barry & alison

Reviews.Title: “Above-and-beyond staff hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Amin M
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through a third-party site which obligated us to those dates, but when I had a death in my family I thought pushing back our stay would turn into a hassle but they were so nice and accommodating it was only a matter of a quick phone call. Once there, the staff was so nice and helpful. When we asked where the nearest liquor store was, they called around and got the phone number, address, and hours of operation of the 3 closest ones. On super bowl sunday we called the hotel while walking around in Times Square to ask if they got the channel for super bowl, they were nice enough to go to our room to check that we had the channel and the reception was clear and called my cell phone back to let us know. Overall our stay was great, we didn't book a huge room but the hospitality of the staff made us very very happy with everything there and we highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: lestatsmikle
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel by accident and once teething problems were sorted, it was an excellent choice. Located right by the subway entrance for the 1 line, getting there couldn't be easier. The Cosmopolitan is located just 5 minutes from Ground Zero and has the wonderful Century 21 Department Store on the doorstep. Staff were generally extrememly helpful and every request I made was received positively. I was even allowed to leave my luggage in storage whilst I flew to the West Coast for a few days - there was no charge for this service. Rooms, however, are very mixed in size and standards. I was initially allocated a room the size of a broom cupboard which wouldn't have been too had had there been a window that faced something other than a very close wall. I asked to be moved to a nicer room and my request was met politely and I was moved to room on the top floor, overlooking the street. What I wasn't told was that there were all night street repairs running and the windows were only single glazed and provided no sound barrier. At 23:00 I'd had enough and asked to be moved again. I was told there was nothing that could be done until tomorrow as there were no other rooms. I reluctantly accepted this, but by 00:00 the situation was intolerable. There was a differant person on reception (Marcin) and he had a much better attitude. He moved me to a room opposite, and that would have been fine had it not been flooded when I went in! Marcin then looked again and found me a suite on the 2nd floor which, although it again faced a wall, was large and spacious, and this compensated. I remained in the suite for the remainder of my 3 night stay. The room was clean and comfortable. It was also quiet and an effective cooling system and fan. I enjoyed my stay and would go back. However, it is clear that the first staff member (who appeared to be of management level) wasn't willing to take appropriate action in the early stages to resolve my issues. This could have been done, but wasn't. Only Marcin's timely and helpful intervention saved the day and ensured that the stay was pleasant and enjoyable. Subject to the above, I would surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Adorei.. just loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth475
Reviews.Content: this is my third time @ Cosmopolitan, a great hotel to stay in NY, wonderful team, great location,clean, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Cosmopolitan never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: roberta91
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in January '12. I have stayed at the Cosmopolitan a few times before, so I already knew that it was a great deal for little $... once again, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms immaculate (albeit on the small side, which could be an issue for larger people), and the location is unbeatable. The surprise for me was the expansion of the bistro (still there, with a slightly more limited menu) to a full restaurant in a larger space on the Chambers Street side - great! Starbucks, subway stop, and a convenience store with ATM all only a few steps away. My favorite place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure where those photos were taken!”
Reviews.Author: TrevorGraa
Reviews.Content: Main complaint is that the room I got on the 3rd floor looked nothing like any of the hotel photos. I am used to NYC sized rooms, so while the size wasn't really the issue, my main complaint is that the rooms small window opens into a central air shaft. The air shaft smelled like exhaust, and it permeated the room. The quality of the finishes is marginal at best, and the cleanliness was average. It is a great price, but considering the street construction going on in front of the main entrance I think the price is about right. They really need to be more representative of what the room look like because they are no where near what is shown on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a convenient downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: BB1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 6 nights during September 2011. Overall it was a great option for those that don't want to spend too much to stay in Manhattan, but want a clean and comfortable hotel. Service was great. Staff were always willing to help and answer any questions. The rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. The air conditioner is good but very loud, not ideal to have on while you sleep. There was a fan however. The lift is very small and slow, so take the stairs. We were on the 5th floor and took the stairs if the lift wasn't waiting at ground level of if there were many people waiting. During our stay two new computers were installed in the foyer for guest use. This was handy for us as we were not travelling with phones/laptops/tablets. Location was great as long as you don't need to be in the Midtown / Times Square area. There is a subway station right beneath the hotel which is serviced by the Red 1 and 2 lines. There are some great restaurants and cafes close by, and it is only a short walk to the 9/11 memorial. Overall we were very happy with our stay. Sure there are much more lavish places to stay in Manhattan, but the Cosmopolitan represents great value for money if you don't plan to be spending a lot of time in your hotel room. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: RuneKaim
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to "everything". Reasonable too, considering the location. On top of that, it's clean, the staff is always helpful and polite, and the rooms and bathroom are big and they all have a/c. I've been staying here three times, and it will definitely be a forth time! Great value :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value Great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Toocooks
Reviews.Content: Wonderful tribeca location. Exceptional value for a NYC hotel. Near downtown shopping and sights and an easy hop on the train uptown. Small rooms and bathroom but its NYC that you want to visit. Stayed 3 nights and will definately recommend and be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: Anthony L
Reviews.Content: Booked this place from a website offering discounted rooms so didnt know what to expect. I was pleasently surprised at the location .. very nice area of Tribeca.. right outside on of th emain Subway lines and walking distance to places like Ground Zero and Chinatown. The rooms were on the small side but very very clean and tidy. The staff were always willing to help and the place was very secure and I never felt in any danger walking around the neighbourhood by myself! The price I padi was a bargain considering where it was and you have a Deli opposite opene 24 hours, Starbucks below, and Reade Street Bar which is 20 seconds walk away and open until the early hours!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: Jane F
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with many things within a quick walk, and a subway entrance right on the corner. Clean, quiet and great bed. Definitely a small room (and bathroom), but I was never really there except to sleep. Friendly staff. But the best part was the room rate! Excellent value and hard to find in Manhattan. I'd stay here again, but if I wanted to splurge I might go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Engine That Could”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: I stay in many Manhattan hotels at many levels and neighborhoods. The Cosmopolitan Hotel is definitely worth a stay. Okay, if you are coming for luxury, go elsewhere. But if you seek value on Manhattan, good neighborhood, subway access, a clean and "better than basic" room AND a staff that is coordinated and eager to please, the Cosmo is the place. Yes, there is construction going on outside but it was very quiet at night and it's not bad during the day either...and soon it will be over. I had trouble with the hot water...maintenance fixed it in five minutes and management followed up 10-minutes after that. This is the little hotel that could...and you should try it.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional NY hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ange_from_cheshire
Reviews.Content: Traditional NY hotel - quite old but been refurbished. Great location in Tribeca near the World Trade Centre site. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby and and there's a subway right outside the hotel. We had an 'odd' loft room which was very narrow with stairs up to a double bed and an en suite bathroom below. We were asked if we were ok with this room and as we were only staying one night it was fine but wouldn't want this kind of room for a longer stay. Breakfast wasn't included in the rate but there was free WiFi. Overall, I would recommend this for a stay in NYC - liked the feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Youngonetravelling
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here over the new year period and had the suite room 705(newest renovated room and HUGE) it is perfect location as subway is right out the front and Starbucks too! The sofa bed isn't the comfiest but sleep able. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. There is construction going on out the front however the room we were in you couldn't hear a thing. The room was a bit hot especially as it was -10 degrees outside although was solved by having th fan on pretty much full time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NotMilk
Reviews.Content: As NYC hotels go, this is a keeper! I loved the location and proximity to everything! Red Line Metro is right outside and everything you could want is within walking distance. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Average Hotel, LOUD outside”
Reviews.Author: JAC110198
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks back and found the hotel to be average. It is an older hotel, the hallway smelled moldy/cleaning product-y, and the elevator only fit 6 people max. But our room was okay, it didn't smell like the hallyway thankfully and there were 4 of us and we never felt on top of each other. The bathroom is pretty small, and needs a fan(!), but otherwise no complaints. However, the noise from the street at all hours of the night/early morning was too much. I live in Chicago, NEXT to our El (elevated train) and can sleep through a lot. Whatever was going out outside was just TOO much. Which, shouldn't reflect on the hotel, but when I pay $300+ for one of the nights I expect to sleep like a baby. I agree the rooms got warm - but we also kept the ceiling fan on and the window cracked a tiny bit which helped (maybe 1/4 of an inch - not enough to let in all that crazy noise). It was like something was constantly scraping down on the street!?! P.S. Our room looked nothing like the professional pictures - but like the customer pictures. Where were those rooms at? The staff was friendly and the location was nice - short cab ride to Little Italy, Chinatown, walk to the 9/11 Memorial. I can't say I'd stay here again unless the construction is done and I'm a room that doesn't face the street. And go to Zucker's bagels for the best bagel EVER! So delicious. Definitely made my morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comopolitan hotel TriBeca NYC”
Reviews.Author: Steven C
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 28th dec 2011 the staff are very friendly and helpful. We are on the fifth floor on the hotel it can get noisy but the bed is very comfortable and I am a light sleeper but I still manage a good 8hours. The room 510 that we are in is very small but we have just not unpacked all our clothes . The cleaners are very good always smile. I would recommend this hotel for a young couples and people to stay here for 3-5days. When you walk outside you will see the new world tree tower one which is growing as we speak.

Reviews.Title: “December in NY”
Reviews.Author: pharmland
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The location is great. The subway is literally right out the front door. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Even the younger bellhops were genuinely nice (all 3 of them that I dealt with). They were not the I have to be nice and polite like some corporate places where it does not seem sincere, just truly nice. The room was clean and small, as I expected when I reserved it. I was in the loft room which I saw some bad reviews on. It was clean, had 2 TVs, a small pull out couch and the bed up in the loft. I would give 5 stars but I paid >$300 for one of the nights and I don't feel it is worth that but overall it was a good choice. The other nights after Dec 10th were considerably more reasonably priced. For some reason Dec 10th was an expensive hotel night in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Small and super noisy (at the time)”
Reviews.Author: Kenyon H
Reviews.Content: There was some construction going on outside which was super loud! Other than that, it's small as you can expect from a lot of hotels in the city, but not a bad stay outside of the noise. Room was decent and staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire_pad
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay here. I had originally booked a standard double but saw a deal for the a loft room for Â£55 per night so snapped it up. The loft room is very small with the bed up a tight staircase. The bed was lovely although there wasn't much room between it and the ceiling. I'm 6ft 4" so this and the tight staircase caused a few issues. No major issues though. Room was very clean, bathroom and shower small and noise was a bit of an issue but fore the price I paid I can't have any major complaints. I wouldn't choice a loft room if you're a couple though, too small. There's a cafe below where I had a great breakfast and Mudville 9 across the road for the best Wings in the City. Subway station right outside so great for getting around. Reade Street pub is just across W Broadway which is a nice bar and Gee Wizz diner a block away for a great breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Jill2509
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean. The room we had was adequately equipped and the bathroom was newly done and clean. Our only issue was the noise - constant noise from the road (at the front of the hotel) with no adequate double glazing and the door to the room opposite (a resident?) left ajar with the TV on throughout most of the night. Not sure about having the window open to adjust the room temperature (as per previous reviewer) - ours didn't open, but we did have a ceiling fan, which we left on constantly to make the air temperature comfortable. An average hotel, very well appointed, but wouldn't stay again because of the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmopolitan for two nights on business in November. I've stayed in many hotels in NYC, and Cosmopolitan ranks somewhere in the middle--it's certainly not the most luxurious, but it's certainly not the worst, either. Overall, it suited my needs and I'd stay again. LOCATION: The location is great. It's right in Tribeca, which was convenient to work meetings by the seaport/Wall Street area. It can be difficult to get a taxi right out front of the hotel, but there are subway stops for all the major lines within a block of the hotel. ROOMS: The rooms are really no-frills and quite small, but they are perfectly clean and comfortable. The room had plenty of space for a solo business traveler for two nights, but if you have more than one person, you'll want to upgrade. The room is a little outdated--an ancient television with basic channels, a tiny safe, and a window air conditioner that is very loud and blows right on your face. If you're traveling in extreme heat or cold, you may be uncomfortable, but it was fine for my mild November evenings. The bathroom looked recently renovated and had just enough space, but was actually larger than other NYC hotels I've stayed in. The shower is European-style, with a half wall. My coworker, however, said her bathroom was very different than mine, so you'll want to make sure you request an updated room. PRICE: I got a corporate rate through a travel agent, which made this hotel a good deal. The rack rates are actually pricey for what you get, though. But, if you can find a deal ($250 or under) then it's a great option if you're looking to save costs. If you don't need to save costs, then I'd suggest upgrading to the Tribeca Grand or another nearby, especially if you're traveling for pleasure. STAFF: The staff was very friendly and helpful, holding my luggage, getting me a taxi, etc. CONCERNS: I had a few concerns when I checked in. The room doors have old-school key locks with a little push-knob, like you'd find on a home bedroom or bathroom. As a solo female traveler, I felt a little nervous about this, but I had absolutely no problems. It's also pretty noisy, so if you plan to sleep in, you'll hear everyone in the halls in the morning. Overall, I was happy with the Cosmopolitan, given my need for an affordable room in a location in lower Manhattan. It wouldn't be my first choice for a leisure hotel, but if you can get a deal, it's a good bet for a seasoned NYC traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Richard0337
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, pristine and pretty bathroom, great view of the Woolworth Building. Bed was a little too soft for my taste, but that's a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid value, great Tribeca location”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmopolitan for one night earlier this week, and will absolutely plan to stay there again. The location in Tribeca is very convenient, right at the Chambers subway station on Broadway. The rooms are quite small relative to the hotels where I usually stay, but the bed was quite comfortable, the wifi free, and the bathroom new and perfectly clean. The staff was very friendly as well. Some rooms, including mine, do not have air conditioners but that was not an issue last week ... in the summer I imagine it would be otherwise. For the cost, I'm tempted to rate it a five-star, as it is certainly a five-star value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan-Hfx
Reviews.Content: The location alone is a reason to stay here. Steps from the subways redline, which can lead to theatre, Times Square, Macy's, Central Park. A block away from the subways blue line which takes you to JFK airport. Close to Canal, 12 minute walk or 2 subway stops, a 3 minute walk to WTC. Great restaurants and night clubs close by. Our room was large by NYC standards (519) 2 queen beds. On the down side is the room was hot as hell and we were out of bed off and on playing with the AC, but this hotel is one we would use again. We have stayed in 15+ hotels in the NYC area and feel this may be the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: I traveled there with 2 of my friends. We were able to get a room with 2 double beds and a pull out sofa for a very reasonable price for NYC. There was nothing glamourous but it was clean and convenient. Metro station was right across the street. From the hotel, you can walk to many different areas. Starbucks was at the ground floor of the building which was very convenient. I would recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: By far this has to be one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Not only were the staff extremely helpful, But the room I stayed in was beautifully designed and the bed was Extra comfy. I really liked the design of the bathroom, Theres something about that tile pattern I like. Not to mention the Huge tv that was in the room, Not that I watched it. The Hotel had an Excellent Wi-Fi Service from the room I was in, and the subway was right outside the door. As for the food from the Cafe, It was a little expensive for my liking but was really nice quality, If found there was heaps of variety around if you just walked a few blocks. Upon Leaving the hotel, I asked the best way to get to the airport and they said they had a special service for only $65.

Reviews.Title: “Was drawn in by the relatively low price of 200 dollars per night for Tribeca...but”
Reviews.Author: mountaindolphin
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip in Tribeca, and chose this hotel because it was the most reasonably priced one near my project. On the plus side, the people are very nice, and the location is fantastic, both for walking and for the subway access. The internet is also good. On the bad side? Really tiny room, decent for one person, inadequate for two, smelly carpets, inside the room and in the hallway, no temperature controls, including no option to turn off the heater in the room, and there is only one tiny elevator to service the entire hotel. I got out of there as soon as I could, but yes, I cannot deny that it was incredibly convenient to stay there for a day before I could source another place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hrefna R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel this month and really enjoyed it. Staff is really friendly and helpful, my room was clean and nice. the location could possibly be better for super shoppers, but there is a subway station few steps from the hotel entrance, so traveling should not be a problem. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: theMerryBerry
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Cosmopolitan a few years ago and having been very pleased with the great location and clean rooms, I simply couldn't wait to return. Unfortunately... this time I was given a room on the Chambers Street side of the building, which was *very* noisy because of the roadworks... even worse, a terrible food cart was parked right smack-dab in the middle of the sidewalk just below our windows !!! Am still wondering how on earth such a thing is allowed.... It made for a very unpleasant, disappointing experience... One last thing, I disagree with the previous reviewer which did not enjoy the hotel's cafe... I, personally was really delighted with both the food and service there.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and no hot water - and staff ignored it!”
Reviews.Author: Vietnamese_Whirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011. This may be Manhattan but for nearly $300 a night I expected much much more. Our room was on the 2nd floor. There are roadworks going on right outside the hotel, plus the traffic from West Broadway anyway. The hotel hasn't even bothered to put in double glazing, so it was incredibly noisy and sleep quality was poor. The room was hot - there's a ceiling fan for air con but it was too loud/cold to use overnight, so your choices are being hot or being cold. Rooms themselves were tiny - two double beds but barely any room to put your luggage or walk around. On our final morning we woke up to NO HOT WATER. So we had to check out without having had a shower for the day, not great. What made it worse was we called hotel reception four times and they didn't even pick up the phone. When we reported it in person the receptionist knew full well what the problem was seemed pretty sheepish about it - but she didn't bother apologising. One of the other reception staff offered us a free breakfast at the cafÃ© next door (by the way don't bother paying $12.50 for that: terrible quality food and rude/unfriendly staff - the kind of people who stopped caring a long time ago and merely count the dollars in their pockets). I overheard numerous other people complaining about countless other things on checkout - I didn't hear anyone say "this was a great place" - and I got the impression hotel staff knew all the shortcomings but couldn't be bothered to address them. It's Manhattan after all, they can keep charging lots of money and getting away with it. Hotel staff were pretty useless whenever we asked for directions, advice on getting to the airport, local information. You know, the kind of stuff people who work on a hotel reception are meant to know. I don't know NY at all well and I couldn't have done a worse job than them. On departure they offered to call us a cab as we had heavy bags. After repeated assurances that they were working on it, 20 minutes later they said a cab wasn't going to happen and we should just get the subway. Massive waste of our time and really inconvenient, but I guess it was fitting that our departure lived up to the same standards as the rest of our stay at this hotel. The only plus about this place is the location - I liked the area and the subway was right opposite. But if you want to stay in Tribeca, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base”
Reviews.Author: thruthelookingglass
Reviews.Content: Just returned form a stay at the Cosmopolitan and have only good things to say. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful for sightseeing. For an NYC hotel, the price was reasonable. This is a great home base for a trip to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Can be hot”
Reviews.Author: SJohan01
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room because of previous reviews and got a room who's windows opened onto a enclosed shaft. The aircon had just been removed for winter and the room was stinking hot and stuffy. The hotel's answer to this problem was to leave the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Hotel was in an excellent location for sightseeing.Our room was at the back so noise free, our friends were at the front so they had quite a bit of noise. Underground right outside.Ground Zero 2 minutes away. Found a wonderful organic food shop locally , also an Amish shop which was incredible! Going back to see the xmas lights one year and would stay at cosmo again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinnHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I spendt there a week. Location is very good and there is a subway station in front of the hotel. Room is clean and it was pretty silent which was surprice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in New York City”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn H
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best deal around for lower Manhattan. There were 5 women and their large luggage in our room (some of us larger than the others) and we were quite comfortable. Two queen and one sofa bed. The bathroom was alright and there was a bonus sink and vanity in the room which made it possible for two of us to get ready at the same time. Also desk and sitting chairs in the room. The room was way larger than expected. And the best thing of all - total for two nights for the 5 of us was $670.26 - $134 each for two nights in Manhattan. Located right across the street from the subway station which made it really easy to hop on and go downtown. Great little family style Italian/deli right down the street with LARGE, inexpensive servings which was handy after the long west/east coast flight. Close to Ground Zero and Statue of Liberty. This was a great place to stay for our quick two night stop prior to our cruise out of New York Harbor. The front staff and bellman were extremely nice and accommodating. Brought extra towels and pillos quickly. Overall I would not hesitate one bit to return to this location. We were thrilled with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hulies
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very nice location. John and Jenny were super friendly, professional and most helpful. Rooms were small but clean and cozy. There was considerable street construction so our streetwise room was rather noisy...even for NYC. This was our first vacation to NYC but we had so much fun we will return. If we stay Downtown we'll come to the Cosmopolitan. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel service and room”
Reviews.Author: ChongSerene
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are very helpful. Hotel room is very new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: MyLifeTravels
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for business meetings as well as a vacation as it was my first time in NYC. My company picked the hotel for me (because they were paying) and at first after looking over the hotel website I thought that my boss had just picked the cheapest and worst hotel he can find. I WAS WRONG! The hotel is located in Tribeca and it was very close to all my meetings as well as all places I wanted to visit as it was my first time in NYC. There were a bunch of subway lines right outside the hotel door therefore travelling to midtown or uptown was an easy thing. There was also a starbucks downstairs, which if you're like me and you can't live without your coffee in the morning that is a big plus! I arrived at the cosmopolitan hotel at around 10AM. I was greeted by a bell man who took my one bag away from me and didn't let it go until I got to my room. Check in isn't until 3pm so I wasn't expecting to be able to check in but to my surprise the very nice lady Marcella told me that my room is ready and I can check in. That was great...a BIG PLUS for me! On top of my early check in I was also given an upgrade from a standard room to a king room. Excellent! The room itself is not a huge thrill but it is up to date and EXTREMELY clean! The amenities were limited but I had just what I needed to survive my week in New York. The only few things that I can complain about is the bit loud ac unit in the window and the lack of coffee makers in the room. Other than that it was all pure perfection! What really beat my expectations was the staff...I've stayed at many places where the hotel staff just doesn't give a s***. It was different here, the staff actually cared about me! From the moment I stepped in the hotel until I checked out a week later I was given the best customer service I could imagine. From whatever I needed whether it was extra towels or directions to my meetings the cosmopolitan hotel staff was always there and always willing and able to help me. I spoke to the morning staff many times throughout my stay (mainly Marcella) and the help I received was always just what I needed plus much more. Whenever I stepped out the front door I knew where I was going, what trains to take, where to buy tickets, etc. thanks to the help of the front desk staff. And on the last night when I realized I have no idea how to get to jfk airport I spoke with the front desk person Martin at 3am and he provided me with the different ways that I can go about getting to the airport. I requested a car service for 4:30am that same night and was reassured that the driver will be on time and waiting...and when I came downstairs the driver was there and ready to take my luggage. Wow! I definitely recommend the Cosmopolitan Hotel for anyone who is travelling to New York and is need of a good hotel with extremely excellent service! The Cosmopolitan hotel is my home for all my future NYC visits!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tiny room & uncomfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: Bzruthie
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient to subway, which was a plus, but the room and bathroom were absolutely tiny and the beds were horribly uncomfortable! This hotel should be rated actually as a 2 1/2 star, not 3 star. The only thing we liked about the room was that it was a corner room with 4 windows....we had north and west views, which was great. However, I would probably not choose to stay at this property on my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterW1967
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in Tribecca area,close to wallstreet,ground zero,battery park. Stayed here 4 yrs ago Subway was in front of the hotel There was lil deli Staff were very nice and helpfull Rooms were too small for me but thay were clean

Reviews.Title: “New York Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: eramylloh
Reviews.Content: The service was quick and friendly, There were always staff on duty. On the day of departure I was able to leave my luggage in a secure room behind the counter. The tube station is right outside so easy to go up town. The room I stayed in was clean, though a bit small and had a small safe. There was no noise to upset your sleep. After the morning rush for showers the hot water ran out. I would have liked tea and coffee making facilities, though there was a Starbucks next door. The area is pretty quite at night, so no evening noise, but also no vibe. Overall a good hotel, if you want more life I would stay further uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nana0330
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Tribeca: the hotel literally sits above a subway stop, which is very convenient to move around NYC. Rooms are rather small but very clean, elevator is v. v. slow... Highlight of our stay were the two lovely cafes downstairs, we had breakfast there on the first morning and were so pleased with the delicious fresh food that we went back many times for lunch and dinner (or for a sweet crepe :) )

Reviews.Title: “Great value in TriBeCa”
Reviews.Author: ZWheeler
Reviews.Content: We found a great rate for the Cosmopolitan on Hotwire, and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this little hotel in TriBeCa. Everyone on staff was friendly and eager to help. After we checked in, the front desk manager, Jaime, even called up to our room to make sure that everything was satisfactory. The room itself was unusual, but fun. The double bed was accessed by climbing a spiral staircase up to a little platform. (If you are over 5'10, watch out, you won't be able to stand up in the loft!) The hotel thoughtfully provided a remote control for the well-functioning, downstairs air conditioner. The neighborhood was busy, but not overwhelming. There were two subway stops nearby, and The Village, SoHo, and lower Manhattan were all within reasonable walking distance. The only real con was the noisy construction on Chambers St. (Could this be why they sold the room at such a low rate on Hotwire?) Also, the loft may not be for everyone, but the hotel does have other options. The Cosmopolitan was a very clean hotel, with a very conscientious staff. We would definitely stay there again, if the rates continue to be within our price range.

Reviews.Title: “High rating for service.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: I place a premium on service, and the staff at the Cosmopolitan were exceedingly friendly, thoughtful, and accommodating. The room itself was okay. It was clean. The bed needs replaced soon, but it was not bad. The AC of the next unit over was loud, but you know what... Tribeca is LOUD anyway. And that brings me to my biggest problem: I don't like Lower Manhattan. I have never liked Tribeca. But, some people really love it, so I will not rate the Cosmopolitan lower for its location. Also, the 1, 3, and 9 lines are right outside the door, which is really the best way to get out of that congested labyrinth. One other thing: I wouldn't bother with their cafe. Catch an uptown train and get a proper breakfast/brunch in the village.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the bed and the elevator, everything was good!”
Reviews.Author: mhot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Sept. 1 - Sept. 5, 2011 and had an overall good experience. The things we didn't like were the bed and the elevator. The bed was supposed to be a double bed, but it was actually more a 1 persons bed, so unfortunately we did not have a very good night sleep, just because we were cramped into bed together. The elevator is really slow. On several occassions we waited approximately 15 minutes for the elevator to reach the floor we were at. We decided it was better to take the stairs, although we were staying at the 5th floor. The good things about this hotel is the price and the location. The location is really great: in the heart of Tribeca with a good subway connection to all major attractions. There are some really nice restaurants just 2 blocks away, so if you're not in the mood for taking a cab or the subway, you can always choose to go to a restaurant within walking distance of the hotel. Times Square is about 5 minutes away with the subway and Soho is around 10-15 minutes with the subway. Furthermore, the hotel staff was friendly. And of course: nothing can beat this terrific price. I know I searched lots of different websites, but I couldn't find a better deal than this! Would I stay another time in this hotel? Yes, BUT only if I can get a guarantee that I will have a normal sized double bed!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: swiss_gooner
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan was perfect. They were very friendly and helpful. So many Europeans could learn from the courtesy given by New Yorkers and the staff of The Cosmopolitan certainly lived up to this expectation. They were attentive, friendly, helpful and happy. There was a slight mistake with my booking but the hotel quickly fixed this and gave me an upgrade to a bigger room at no extra cost. The hotel is perfectly situated for downtown Manhattan. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. From this location you can easily walk up to Mid Town or explore all of downtown TriBeCa and China Town, NoLita and The Village on foot. There is a subway station a minute away which is also a great convenience. From this location you are never more that a $10 taxi uptown. There is good shopping nearby at Century21 and there are nice restaurants with China Town, Little Italy and TriBeCa all with much to offer. Ground Zero is only a few minutes way by foot as is Battery Park and if you'd like to walk across Brooklyn Bridge, you are not far away. I will certainly recommend this hotel and will use it again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissJetSetterLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and couldn't recommend it more! There are 5 subway lines available at Chambers St which made it easy to go anywhere, Soho was a short walk up W. Broadway and like another reviewer said most places were no more than $15 cab ride including Midtown and Brooklyn. The local amenities were perfect with plenty of things under the building or within a block for late night/last minute needs such as a nail salon, Starbucks, pizza places etc. On the contrary to other reviewers I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, however it wasn't my first visit to NY so perhaps I relied on them less! An iron was also a permanent feature in my standard double. My only complaint was the lack of space in the tiny bathroom...no counter meant carrying a toiletry bag back and forth. However the solution would be to opt for a larger room, oh and I managed to have my room cleaned up until about 2/3pm! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a hotel with a good location to use as a base while out enjoying the city!

Reviews.Title: “Not a value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kgbdfb
Reviews.Content: Each day I have had to call to ask for housekeeping to come to my room. The front desk person has asked why I need it. There is no business center, no amenities whatsoever, the rooms are small and very noisy - both with outside noise and the incredibly loud air conditioning, which I have to turn off to talk on my cell phone. I wouldn't mind any of that if I were paying a reasonable rate, but the rates are much better at much better hotels than this. Stay uptown a bit and take a cab down here every day if you need to be here.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Adam's Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehub
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan is actually not in a bad location but everything is pretty sub par. We paid $275 a night during Labor Day weekend, which for New York isn't unreasonable, but there are much better places one can get for this price. The rooms are small and need major revamping. They even have actual keys, rather than the key car. We also got stuck in the elevator-twice- which was pretty scary and HOT. The most unbelievable part of the experience, however, was the staff. We asked the simple question of where to get good brunch nearby. They told us a place called Gee Whiz (think the worst pub food of your life- shriveled shrimp and overprocessed chicken wings). When I said we'd ordered from there and it was bad the guy shrugged and had zero additional other suggestions. He just didn't care. Let's be serious, Tribeca has plenty of brunch places with decent food, which we found out no thanks to the hotel folks. Overall, this is not the worst place ever but it's pretty close. Avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: TPeezy
Reviews.Content: It's a clean hotel, definitely no bedbugs. We had two rooms both with double double beds, one was 420 and the other was 427. One was really small, and the other one was a normal size. They don't have central air, so it's an air conditioning unit. My biggest complaint is probably just that housekeeping wouldn't come after like 1:00pm. We woke up late everyday, so our room didn't get cleaned the whole time we were there. The good news is although they didn't come in and clean, they had no problem bring us fresh towels when we asked. The room didn't have an iron, but they promptly brought one from downstairs. It's also a great location, we paid $10.00 or less for a taxi ride everywhere we went! Plus the subway station is literally right outside of the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy - and compact”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Sue
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel close to two main subway lines (Chambers St) and reasonable rates for travellers on a budget - but the old saying "you get what you pay for" was never more true. The room was tiny, but served its purpose well - we were there to see Manhattan, not sit around a room watching TV all day. Room was clean, and room service was attentive. Desk staff very helpful, especially when it came to booking an early morning car for Newark International.

Reviews.Title: “Low price option for an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: WABillieT
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for "best room available", a continental breakfast and wifi at $150 per night (a great deal in this area of NYC). The room provided was clean, the cable tv reception very poor, extremely small (really, barely bigger than a closet), and the front desk clerk very rude (seemed like she was always working so maybe she was tired!). The hotel is well located, again it was clean, and the other staff there was very nice. Continental breakfast was great and all rooms had wifi (no need to pay extra!). It actually worked well for the situation we found ourselves in at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: katri0na
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely for the rates, which are really low by NY standards. The rooms are very small, the elevator is slow and there's no hotel restaurant - but for the money we paid there's really no reason to complain. It's clean, safe and the staff - who may not be the friendliest people - are efficient in sorting out any problems you might come across at the hotel. The location is fantastic, the subway is two steps away - and nobody spends a lot of time in hotel rooms when they're in New York anyway. Over all, staying at the Cosmopolitan hotel is a great way to save money on a trip to NY and I'd deffinetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Gasper321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Cosmopolitan for 10 days in april/may. Check in was easy, staff kind and helpfull. Rooms are nice and clean, roomy and comfy. Bathroom is small but you have everything you need. The pipes don't make any noise. After about four/five days the cleaning lady also left in our room an iron and desk which was very kind and thoughtfull. This hotel really helped make our stay in New York beautiful! The only complaint would be the noise from the streets...there is quite a lot of holes between the window and AC so you can hear everything from the streets, so long sleeps in the morning weren't possible. But this didn't bother us much..there is so much to do and see in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very Clean, Great Location - We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: So happy to find this hotel! The hotel was very clean. It is a convenient location. It is a reasonable price. We will stay here everytime from now on. We stayed in a junior double - i would suggest springing for a larger room. We will try the mini-loft next time. If you are by yourself a junior double would probably be ok. The only problem we experienced was the A/C unit was very loud and clicked on and off all night. However - i think had we had a larger room, it might not have seemed so loud. But we never heard any noise from the street or from any neighboring rooms. The restaraunt on the ground floor was excellent - we had breakfast there. Overall, I think this is a great place to stay if you don't want to spend a large part of your vacation budget on just the hotel. No frills - but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: gado36
Reviews.Content: Our room was excellent for our family of 5 (2 comfortable queen beds and a pull-out), roomy with high ceilings (room 305). Extremely clean, as we had read in other reviews, and it was very quiet. The location was great, having a subway stop right out the door, and it was a nice neighbourhood to escape to each night away from the crowds. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Our flight arrived early in the day and left late at night, but the hotel was very good about storing our luggage before and after checking out. We appreciated that they extended our checkout time by a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: x10white
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small for the price, but location is great. We had a one double bed and private bathroom but overall felt like you were in a closet. There was also no view from the window but it's very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OALEWIS
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, good value for New York price range! Great location in Tribecca with a subway stop right outside. There is a lovely restaurant at the side of the hotel where we ate breakfast every morning. There is also a lovely little cafe at the entrance and a newsagents right at the entrance with was convenient for buying snacks and water etc. The rooms are small but clean. I would say here again when in New York. Tip: Do the free walking tour with www.freetoursbyfoot.com. Having never been to New York before this was excellent for really getting to know each area. We did the ''All In One Tour.''

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best !”
Reviews.Author: George7669
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely clean and well kept. Bathroom fixtures are state of the art, and beautiful. Very large rooms, high ceilings. (Room 205). Great hotel staff - very friendly and helpful. Has an ice cream parlor, and cafe resturant, both excellent. Very close to subway entrance, (right outside the side door) and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Route66”
Reviews.Author: Janep18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on our road trip . Could t fault it for the cost and proximity . Rooms were small but then we only slept there as we were so busy . Helpful staff , rooms well maintained , no view but again spent so little time in room that it was irrelevant . Would stay again when in new york

Reviews.Title: “The top of the highest valuation”
Reviews.Author: Dimitrios_Ganas
Reviews.Content: There is no sufficient number of stars to express a vote of appreciation for your "Cosmopolitan Hotel". Being found by the cleaning staff, a forgotten precious jewel in the room, and deliver it to your administration to return to us customers who had already left the hotel, is a gesture of great respect and honesty, which places the your hotel at the top of the highest valuation. I offer you heartfelt greetings our gaming, and again many thanks. Dimitrios Ganas

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: allefe
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Convenient to subways *Very clean *Reasonable rate (which I needed b/c I was staying 6 nights -- If I was only staying a couple of nights, I would have paid more for another hotel) Cons: *Noisy due to daily street constuction (but that's a temporary problem) *Outdated window air conditioner that was difficult to adjust *Doors in hotel were heavy, so you heard them closing constantly (hotel seems to have lots of cleaning staff always working on the rooms -- a mixed blessing) *Wi-fi was spotty (would rather pay a nominal fee for a better connection) *No ice machine available for guest use -- you have to ask the staff to get you ice *Some of the front desk staff were less than friendly *If this is your first or only trip to NYC, you're better off staying in a more central location like mid-town. Otherwise you'll be taking the subway a lot to get to many of the NYC attractions.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean, close to subway, and in a trendy but not so exciting area.”
Reviews.Author: penracer
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very comfortable considering the room was a bit small. plusses - clean, free wifi, subway station at doorstep, trendy area, posh bars/restaurants. minuses - no good cafes/coffee nearby, no good casual dinner options (apart from 'kitchenette'), construction work outside, expensive shops, not such an exciting area if you have not been to NYC before. could improve - need to top up the soap after a couple of days and a full length mirror wouldn't go astray. also, the lift really is very slow!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: prosebud
Reviews.Content: Delightful place to stay and so convenient to transportation, restaurants, etc. Comfortable bed, good a/c, modern tv, clean and neat. Gracious and reliable service from front desk - even late at night. A real value and surprisingly quiet for the area. I have already booked here for the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons....”
Reviews.Author: showmeadeal
Reviews.Content: Wanted to give this hotel a 4 but had to mark it down due to the staff. My sixteen yr old son and I drove here from Indiana for a six night stop on our roadtrip this summer. Having never visited NYC I was a little overwhelmed at driving into the city. I had planned on driving straight to the parking garage the hotel has a deal with and leaving my car. I found the hotel fairly easy with the GPS (after a nerveracking Holland tunnel). However due to construction there was no place to pull up to the hotel to get directions to the garage. I was actually hoping they had a valet but they didn't. I ended up parking illegally and leaving my son in the car to run in and get some guidance. The hotel staff just took me to the door and pointed and said it's just right over there. I was so worried about my car being illegally parked I didn't think to get a street address and they sure weren't going to offer it. They were not helpful AT ALL. No garage name, no street address, no map nothing. In the end I had to pull over and call Hotels.com to get the hotel's number to get a specific address. Construction was all over the place and the GPS keep telling me to go the wrong way down one way sts. I couldn't even find the hotel again. So 2 hrs and alot of gray hairs later, my son and I arrive at the front desk with out luggage. The front desk staff thought this was funny. When I told them that we would get our bag ourselves and we didn't need any help. The guy actually had the nerve to say, I don't know you might get lost on the way to your room. UNBELIEVABLE! Not a good start. Now that I got that off my chest..... Pros: Very clean rooms, plasma tv, free fast wifi,subway right outside the door (best by far) Cons: Hotel staff, tiny bathroom, dated rooms, no BRAVO tv, no ice machines (you hvae to call the front desk, I called twice after no one came after 25 min), slow elevator

Reviews.Title: “Would use again”
Reviews.Author: vmr1270
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week. Location: It's convinentaly located to two Subway stops. The 1/2 subway stop is right outside the door and the A/C stop is on the next corner. This made it easy to get everywhere we wanted to be and it was nice after a long day of sightseeing to not have to walk blocks to our hotel. It has a cafe and Starbucks right downstairs in case you want to get an early breakfast. Room: VERY clean, room size is what I would expect of NYC, there were 3 of us and we were comfortable, the bathroom was clean and enough room. Beds at first felt too firm but after walking all day they were utterly comfortable. We had a room on the street side which was noisy all night long, but we happen to wear headphones and listen to music so that tuned out the street noise. If that would bother you I would request a room in the interior/higher up/earplugs. We were on the 6th floor. I don't remember hearing anyone in the rooms next to ours. Service/Amenities: Checked in quickly, checked out even quicker. When I asked them for a way to get to LGA they scheduled a car to pick us up at the flat rate of $45 (tolls/service charges/etc included), which I belive is the going rate. The driver was on-time, had us there in 30 min. (we left the hotel at 3 p.m.). The elevator was slow we only used it to go up and for luggage. The 3 of us with our luggage fit in there. No a/c in the elevator so was stuffy/slight stench. When our toilet wasn't flushing properly we let the front desk know and when we came back it was fixed. The staff was friendly and answered any/all questions when we were there and e-mails sent beforehand. They will hold your luggage if you get there early or flight leaves later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: peterpumpkinhead
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights in one of the "junior double" rooms located away from the street. The room was fairly small and basic but it was clean and comfortable and perfectly quiet. The hotel is very conveniently located just a few yards from the Chambers St subway and with lots of amenities just a few minutes walk away, such as Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, 7-Eleven and a few local restaurants. The free wireless is one of the fastest and most reliable I've used in a hotel before. If you're ok with small and basic rooms and simple service but in a great location and for a reasonable price then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: TommyBoy94
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry I'm a little late with this review, but, all things considred, this is one of my favorite hotels to stay in New York City. It used to be an even greater value, but you can still get in there for under $200 much of the time. The staff is seasoned and helpful, though they won't dazzle you with eagerness. The rooms are average size (I would compare the place to a 3 star hotel in Paris) and the bathrooms are in the room, not down the hall. The hotel is clean, safe and has a certain charm as a place with history. Considering the expense of many hotels in NYC, this is quite a value for the price.The real bonus is that it is in TRIBECA, perhaps my favorite neighborhood in the city. TRIBECA is a real mix of art, high culture, grittiness and sleeze. It is well downtown (TRIBECA means Triangle Below Canal) and is below SOHO, Greenwich Village and Gramercy Park. It is filled with every type of restaurant and bar; some very high class and some for those of us with an occassional taste for the lowlife. I would definitely recommend a visit to the Patriot Bar for a dose of great, loud country music and reasonable drinks served up by great women who sometimes dance on the bar and sometimes throw ice cubes at you. Again, you can clean yourself up(Especially if you find yourself with a person of taste at some point) and dine and drink and shop at whatever level of elegance suits you. This is a really varied scene. When you are not partying, walk 5 minutes over to the World Trade Center site for an immediate immersion into our most somber recent history. You are also close to battery park and the watery tip of Manhattan scene. The Chambers St. train is just outside the entrance to the Cosmopolitan. You can ride uptown from that stop or venture down into some of the various now-trendy neighborhoods of Brooklyn,

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan_K73
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for visiting NYC. We stayed for 8 nights. The room was a nice size, had a wardrobe, desk and flat screen tv. Was very clean. The bathroom was small but had all you needed. The view from the window was great. Looking at the Woolworth building. Staff are nice and helpful when asking questions. Be aware that the hotel is lovely but there is a good bit of street noise. You can't fault the hotel for this as it's NYC. Bins are collected on the street in the middle of the night every night during the week. I slept with earplugs so barely heard a thing. Location is great, nice restaurants and bars nearby. Lovely coffee shop below and a Starbucks. Subway outside the hotel or a short walk to city hall will get you to most places in manhattan. Takes about 10 min to get to midtown by sub. Would stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit was just as pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: Similar to my initial review (june 2010). This was once again a pleasurable stay at the Cosmo Hotel. We loaded up a room with several friends and enjoyed see the sights for a weekend. Rooms are understandably small but if we had a normal amount of people in the room (2 people for 2 doubles instead of 5) its actually quite nice. The smallest part of the room is the bathroom, but it gets the job done. Great location, cute little cafe adjacent and within walking to Brooklyn Bridge/World Trade and it is directly over a subway stop which is great for lugging all your stuff to and from the bus depots. Staff usually asks us whether we would like an inside (alley) facing room or a street facing room. First time we did inside and it was a bit dark, city was noisier but not unpleasantly so. Will definitely continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: santo71
Reviews.Content: It is a quite Hotel. Don't expect to find a bar at the hotel, they don't have, only a entrance hall. The rooms are not big, specially if you are sharing the room. The cleaning could be better, mas nothing major was found... Noisy, from the street... Tiny bathroom Good location, just in front of subway.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not great.”
Reviews.Author: lilyipper
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not very picky with hotels especially when vacationing with my girlfriends. we just want something cheap so we can stumble back to our rooms after partying and pass out. But I hated my room (505). The window air conditioning was loud and I felt like crap when I woke up in the morning. Old school hotel with tiny elevators and the tradition metal key. One key per room. no fancy card keys which makes it pretty inconvenient. I was locked out at 4am when my roommate didn't answer the door. at which point I got worried wondering if she even made it back from the bar. I went downstairs to the front desk and asked them to open the door. They said they would send someone - that person came, opened the door, then walked away. I was kind of shocked! Lucky she was there, just passed out and probably couldn't hear me banging on the door due to the super loud air conditioner. No bedbugs though. thank good. Location was fine. close to the harbour and Ground Zero. Cafe downstairs had excellent croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for exploring New York”
Reviews.Author: Angellous
Reviews.Content: Well laid out plenty of space in a clean and tidy room a great base to explore New York just around the corner from Ground Zero and a short walk to the Battery. They have no resturant but plenty of eating places of all price ranges within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hazelmelanie
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel last may and i must say i was satisfied overall with my stay. The hotel is conveniently located near the Chambers st subway station which makes travelling uptown such a breeze. The staff are very friendly. They gave us free upgrade to a bigger room and they were very accomodating with respect to requests for extra pillows, repairs etc. The rooms were clean although a bit too small (especially the basic room where you can hardly walk if you have luggage) but overally it was well maintained. Bathrooms were clean and towels were aplenty. There is no restaurant within the hotel but the cosmopolitan cafe next door is a must try. The crepes are lovely and coffee is good. Starbucks is also next door.

Reviews.Title: “No value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: krupanidhi_hm
Reviews.Content: It's at the down town close to all tourist destination. But you pay more for nothing but to be in the down town. No good restuarant, service is unknown here and even you dont get a proper response for booking thro' net on Hotels .com etc. Horrible to be here alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to subway, food, downtown shopping”
Reviews.Author: reke2011
Reviews.Content: Clean and good location. Nice staff. Pls ask for a room away from theroad. I paid a good bit to stay a night and did not sleeep a wink. The noise from the road was too bad..soundproofing anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Hooked and can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Alisonmcauliffe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmopolitan hotel and it was the 1st time for 2 English ladies in NYC.Clean friendly reasonably priced location.The 1st morning of our week long trip we decided to use the Cosmopolitan cafe for breakfast we were hooked.Craig Bero the proprietor and his staff including Moose and the girl's could not have made us more welcome and nothing was a problem. I lost my purse outside this cafe and was approached by a gentleman outside who could see we we're looking for something .He asked us if we we're looking for a little black purse because he'd witnessed a girl hand it in to Starbucks on the corner.Amazing. Tribeca what a fantastic location central to everything.To call the Cosmopolitan a cafe is an understatement the food is wonderful and so reasonably priced.Craig is obviously New York at it's best and you must ask him to show you the back room.This area suffered greatly after 9/11 and the back room has been constructed with artifacts and object's that Craig single handedly salvaged there after.This place became home from home while in NYC and we cannot wait to return. alison.mcauliffe@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Best choice ever made”
Reviews.Author: Gelatinna
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 1st to NYC without knowledge of what could happen that day and this was our truly first time in this city. We tried to go almost 10 years ago (09/11/01) but the flight was suspended so these dates are truly unforgettable and the hotel made â€‹â€‹the trip even more memorable thanks to its location, staff and services. The hotel is a fascinating very well cared old building. The room (a bit small but who goes to NYC to be all day locked in a room?) and bathroom were perfectly spotless every time we came back from a hectic day in NYC, the mattresses, pillows and linens were of good quality so we slept quite well and the outside noise did not affect us (yes, noise, but this is how NYC is!) In addition, the room decoration and bathroom design were really nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they speak Spanish so there were no communication problems. We took advantage of our stay thanks to the hotel location which it's 4 steps away from a subway station (Chambers St. - Line 1), Starbucks on the first floor, excellent bakeries and groceries 1 or 2 blocks away, 4 subway stations from Times Square (taking the Express #2) 3 blocks from Brooklyn Bridge, 4 blocks away from Ground Zero and the Financial District. In addition to the area is quite safe, my sister and I (young women) came back more than once shortly after midnight and still had people walking in the street. It was our best choice, the hotel gave us more than we expected, we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and location.”
Reviews.Author: beckar00
Reviews.Content: We go to New York about 2-3 times a year for a pleasure trip and try to stay in a new part of the city each time we visit. This was our first time in Tribeca and had a nice experience. I was a bit scared at first since it was not a hotel that I was familiar with but the staff and location won me over. The Cosmo is located right across from the subway and is very convenient to access from several subway lines. The rooms were clean and small (expected this --- as we were in NY). The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: rc_1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in March and really enjoyed it - very clean, comfortable room, great location, great cafe next door. Would definetely recommend it and will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, inexpensive. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Merylfan15
Reviews.Content: stayed with my daughter when we were looking at colleges. rooms were very clean, comfortable beds and you can not beat the price. For sure would stay here again, in fact, just told a friend they need to stay here when they visit the city in a few months. Love Tribeca ! Subway right outside hotel, lots of great places to eat ( both inexpensive and 5 star).. Only draw back was it was a bit noisy with the subway ( and the guy who insisted on tying his barking dog up outside Starbucks every morning) but hey - it's New York City !!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: robbie999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with my two grown up sons, we had a Queen suite which was very spaciouswith a good size bathroom too.The staff on the desk were very helpful and there was a lot of cleaning staff which would explain the cleanliness of the hotel and rooms. Location is great with the subway so closeand Zuckers bagels over the road is breakfast "heaven" best coffee i had in all NY. The cafe below is run by the hotel where you can eat good food in really nice surroundings. At The Cosmo u dont just get what u paid for u get much much more.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convienient”
Reviews.Author: Mairin23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Tribeca. Spotlessly clean and fantasticv position, walking distance to Ground zero and subway just out the door. The room was small. 2 queen bed in the one room accommodating 4 women, very tight and messy at times. The bathroom is tiny. But the room is there for sleeping in only. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: zebedee77
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the heart of TriBeCA, downtown Manhattan. Hotel was booked as part of a surprise break by my partner so I don't know how much it cost but he assures me it was good value. Reservation and check in went smoothly. Our room was compact but well designed, modern and had everything we needed - ensuite shower room, comfortable bed, plenty of clothes storage, toiletries, hair dryer, iron and ironing boards, tourist info about New York and the local area and free wifi. It was spotlessly clean and serviced daily during our three night stay. Staff were friendly and available if we needed anything but we had no need to call on them. The hotel is room only but has two little cafes on the ground floor. Both were nice but the smaller one in particular was very friendly and great for breakfasts. Within 15 minutes walk to the business district, Battery Park where the ferry to Liberty Island leaves from, Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges, LIttle Italy, Soho, etc. Chambers Street subway station literally right across the road giving access to Times Square, Central Park and attractions such as the Empire State Building. Onyl downfall was the roadworks going on outside the hotel which started early on the Monday morning. Not the fault of the hotel though and just bad timing on our part. First trip to New York and it lived up to all our expectations. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “As always a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jtsmom617
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and as usual it was a great experience. the staff is always helpful and friendly - and they did not dissapoint me this time either and the location is so convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality - Price Relation”
Reviews.Author: JoseAlbertoLeno
Reviews.Content: Pretty small and warm rooms (maybe too warm) , but clean Hotel. Nice Location, 3 blocks to Ground Zero and 7 blocks to Soho. One step from Chambers Street Station. Free Wifi and Service is Ok. For the price you are paying to stay at Manhattan is a pretty good Hotel. If you pay that price in another Hotel of the City you'll probably stay at a very dirty Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little Gem”
Reviews.Author: EMcG88
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little Gem in the middle of downtown Tribeca. My husband and myself stayed at the Cosmo March 17th-20th for a mini vacation. I have family who lives on the same street (Chambers) that this wonderful little hotel is on, so we decided to give it a whirl based on the proximity to my family and the price. Depending on what airport you are coming from their might be some different ways to get to this hotel, but they should all be very easy. My husband and I flew into JFk, took the air-train to Howard Beach station and then transferred to the A train which actually stops almost right next door to the Hotel which was VERY easy to find. The whole trip took about 45 minutes. The hotel is the longest running hotel in NYC, but don't let that scare you, because they take very good care of it. The hotel is small, so if you are traveling with a larger group of people, this hotel is not for you. Check-in was quick and friendly and in no time we were on our way to our room, which was a Mini-Loft on the third floor. The mini loft is a little secret that is perfect for a couple. The room was small but plenty big enough for the two of us, and it was probably the cleanest room I have ever been in. It was quiet and comfortable and just what we needed. The location of the hotel is prime. Their are several Train stations close by to travel anywhere in the city. There is a lot of road construction going on that my family stated will take about a year to complete, so if you are picky about that then this might be a kicker. We did not have any problem with noise. There are two little cafe's down stairs which are adorable and for the Pastry lover, a big hit! There is also a Starbucks right down-stairs.
