There are plenty of Restaurant options available near by. There is only one elevator in the building and it can take a few minutes to arrive sometimes, but the stair case is right next to it. So if you are a budget solo or couple traveler, looking for a cute, clean hotel in a great location, then this is it. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Ann617
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel (last Saturday and Sunday nights). This is my third time staying at the Cosmopolitan Hotel, and it is always unfailingly a positive experience. The cleanliness, newness, location, and affordability of the hotel are great. But what is especially great is the service. I checked in at 11:30 on Saturday, and my room was ready! (This is the second time my room has been ready when I checked in in the morning, which is great). The room was gorgeous and roomy, but unfortunately, had a mothball smell I didn't like. When I asked the front desk clerk if he could change my room, he said they were sold out but he would see what he could do. Within 5 minutes, I had a new, ready room to look at. And because it was smaller than what I had originally booked, and on the inside instead of the outside, he gave me a discount. And I still got the wonderful winter special breakfast!!! Choice of a yummy crepe, oatmeal with fruit or yogurt with fruit at the excellent cafe next door. I can't say enough nice things about how professionally and warmly the clerk handled this. He was good natured and accommodating, and the rate deduction (to what I felt were already affordable winter rates) seemed especially generous. He made an already loyal customer feel appreciated and accommodated-and that it happened on a weekend the hotel was sold out was especially great. I am a loyal customer and will be back. Note that the rooms are all extremely clean and very new; the hotel's prices are great because you don't pay for a restaurant or bar or other stuff. There are great restaurants in the area, and I like staying here because both the east & west sides are easily accessible via subway (the 1/2/3 stop is literally on the front doorstep). Try the Cosmopolitan--you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem of a Tourist Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: HugeTexasFoodie
Reviews.Content: We have been to NYC many times and have stayed all over the city. However, we find ourselves gravitating to the relative peace and quiet down in Tribeca. While this hotel is downtown, the location is awesome. It sits abve the Chambers MTA station and stations for other lines are within a few blocks walk. While the rooms are small (it is NYC after all), the staff is pleasant and helpful and the rooms are exceptionally clean and well laid out. The price cannot be beat either. A King Room for under $300 dollars in Manhattan is a steal. I cannot speak highly enough of this indpendently owned Gem. If you want more glitz and glamor, go stay at one of the chains and head uptown to Times Square. To be honest, it just means that there will be more space for us at the Cosmo when we come to the city. Two tips: Walk down the street to Zucker's for an amazing New York bagel. Visit the little bodega shop on the street in the hotel as they have amazing prices on sodas and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I want to share how pleasant this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: SRtheBrave
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan is not a fancy hotel but its the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at. Its old and the rooms are small but its clean and quiet and well maintained. The staff is polite and helpful. The cafe is delightful with wonderful fresh coffee and delicious fresh baked goods. The location is great, quick access to the subways (1,2,3 and A. C, E) and so many great small restaurants are within easy walking distance.Free Wi Fi in the rooms, flat screen tvs.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca Gem”
Reviews.Author: TribecaGal_11
Reviews.Content: Not your high priced 5 star hotel but EVERYTHING you need for a stay in New York City. Rates are reasonable, especially for this area of NYC. Excellent location, every subway line within one block of each other, even one right on corner of hotel. Walking distance to Wall St, Village, SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy. Many fine restaurants in area as well. Rooms are clean, bed was comfortable. While room are on the small size they are quite adquate. Let's face it, how much time do you spend in your hotel room when on vacation or even on a business.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - Quaint - Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mebager
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Cosmopolitan has been wonderful! I travel on business every week and I ran across this hotel by word of mouth. The subway stops could never be more convenient to upper/lower manhatten. There are many little cafe's, bars, restaurants close by to choose from. The hotel has a quaint comfortable look to it. I have stayed numerous times and each room I have been given has its own uniqueness. The rooms have been modernized, cable tv, and best of all free internet. The staff is very pleasant and always goes over and beyond to make your stay comfortable to accommodate your needs. I have never had a bad experience with my stays and look forward to my future stays.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: howieScotland
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and the area. Hotel - staff very helpful - room very clean and tidy - bathroom a bit small however all ammenites - breakfast lovely - metro outside main entrance - walking distance to brooklyn bridge, ground zero, ferry to statue of liberty Area - Tribeca - Great area is you are looking to get a away from the mania of up town and relax at night - lots of bars and restaurants - it is about a forty minute walk from times square, easy walk ,easy to find even if your map reading skills are as bad as mine or a 5 minute tube ride - great atmosphere - people very friendly - close to SOHO

Reviews.Title: “Shoe box rooms, literally, crap lift, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nomisimo
Reviews.Content: Very very small rooms, clean enough, however not a great location, close to Ground zero and century 21 shopping. About a 20min walk to Soho. Got stuck in lift twice, not very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good price,and conviently located.”
Reviews.Author: Colin1945
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Rooms are efficient and have all necesarry equipment, such as hair dryer, iron and ironing board.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and affordable rooms”
Reviews.Author: csuervirgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week for the last 3 years. I will also stay there is 2011. The hotel is located on Chambers and W. Broadway. Entrance to the subway is on the corner which made travel to and from tourist attractions very convenient. I also took the number 20 bus which goes from Times Square and all the way to Battery Park. The area around the hotel is very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced and clean hotel in lower Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: krenman
Reviews.Content: My company regularly uses the Cosmopolitan for work visits to lower Manhattan. This hotel has provided consistant service of low prices and clean rooms. Decent restaurants are scattered around the neighborhood. Its not that far from some tourist attractions either. I would request a room on the higher levels of West Broadway though. They use window shakers for summer air conditioning. With the window open, sound can be an issue on the lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: Lolaloo22
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel. For NYC, you cannot beat the price or the location. Right in the heart of Tribeca, it is walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown, East and West Village, etc...The subway stop is right on the corner so you are literally only 10-20 minutes from anywhere in Manhattan. The rooms are small but who cares? They have everything you need, including a flat screen TV, free wifi, a mini fridge. The staff was friendly and the place was very clean. The walls are thin, so be prepared to hear people in the hallway. But other than that, there is nothing bad I can say. Just booked to stay again for a night in January. Now that I've found this place, I won't stay anywhere else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Nadja023
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, but have never experienced such bad service anywhere in the world. One thing is that the rooms are very small and the elevator didnâ€™t work while I stayed a week at the 7th floor, but the actual problem is the hotel staff. I was treated very disrespectfully several times by the management of the hotel and I even almost lost my airplane because I had asked the hotel staff to help me arrange transportation (livery service) to the airport ...which they didnâ€™t! Instead they called a private former employee, who showed up in his private car almost 2 hours later. I had no time to wait for a alternative transportation and was even overcharged. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone...!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super clean and cosy!”
Reviews.Author: natalie081
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the cosmo for 3 nights last weekend, from 9th-12th dec 2010, our room was on the 3rd floor 302, was average sized not small, had all new fitments, carpets, beds, curtains etc and was really clean and tidy, new bathroom as well with a really hot powerful shower, no faults at all. We had requested a quiet room which is what we got at the back of the hotel, no view, just walls and windows but was perfect for us, i'd rather have a good nights sleep than traffic noise! The room we stayed in had 2 double beds which had very comfortable mattresses and a large flatscreen tv on the wall across, basic toiletries were provided, soap, shampoo, mouthwash etc which we didn't need but still nice they were there. The room was lovely and warm but not stifling, there was also a ceiling fan as well as the obligatory air con, we had no complaints, none whatsoever, my only slight want would be a coffee machine, but app that's normal in new york, you don't tend to get one, however starbucks is just downstairs so not a problem, we would definately stay here again and i've already recommended it to a few people since i've been back. As first timers to new york the location was perfect, subway stop (chambers st) just outside we could get anywhere within minutes on the 123 lines. Glad we didn't stay round times square was mental, really manic and not somewhere to relax after a long day! This was great, we tried the mudville bar across the street, great chicken and ribs, also the cosmopolitan cafe downstairs twice for breakfast, very nice food! Great yoghurt, granola and fruit. Loads of bars, restaurants etc nearby, we were a couple of blocks from ground zero, worth the visit but if like me you're easily upset don't go to the museum bit, i was really moved by it and had to leave before i totally lost it, really sad/moving. Century 21 is also next to ground zero, is a bit like tk maxx, bit busy but i got a few things. There are quite a few shops near the hotel, pharmacies, whole foods store, a petco shop where i bought a few dog toys/treats for my 2 beasties even a hardware store where my husband bought a few tools for work, all in all the perfect city hotel. We will i think be going back here in a few years, nxt year we're stopping at the empire which is a bit more flash, we got it as a great price though as a package, but to be honest i think i'd rather come back to the cosmo! One other thing we booked through hotel conxions after some great advice from some new york forum members, totally great experience with them, really painless! Thanks forum members you were great and got us a great hotel! One last thing, thanks to Jamie on the front desk for organising us a car to newark airport, cost us $68 plus tip, same as a cab but a lot easier!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: bern101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Cosmo - Room was small - with just one double bed but as we weren't planning to spend much time in there apart from sleeping it was fine. Lovely and clean, staff were friendly. We were on the top floor at the back of the building so it was very quiet. Lovely and warm room as well. Had a couple of breakfasts in the Cosmo Cafe downstairs which was really nice and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1happytraveller40
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Location was close enough to the centre to do everything we wanted. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms small but clean and considering we spent most of the time out and about it suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jkrazy04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cosmopolitan four nights and couldn't have been happier with the great value and service. Very basic hotel, no bells and whitsles but for the price I would recommend this hotel to anyone. A few side notes: we had the room with two queen beds and a sofa sleeper, the room was really hot and we actually had two fans running non-stop to cool it down a bit. The beds are very stiff and not very comfortable but after a night or two you get used to them. The staff was very friendly. The elevator is very slow. The Chambers St. station is right outside the door which is very nice, along with a nice cafe and a Starbucks. If your looking for a cheap place to stay that is clean in a safe area stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Cosmpolitan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaley104
Reviews.Content: Always looking for a good deal, we chose the Cosmpolitan Hotel in the Tribeca area of New York for our 4 day day in NY. We were very happy with the quality and cleanliness of the Hotel and we felt safe there. The room was on the small side and we did hear the street noise but it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the Time Square, downtown area. The Hotel is located on 2 major Subway lines and our experience was that the Express trains and the local trains all stopped at Chamber St. The Red line, 1, 2 or 3 had a stop right outside the door. The Cafe associated with the Hotel served great food, I recommend the Applesauce Crepe. We would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Exceptional Value & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MiniMarina
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay somewhere that has character, than this is it, if you want a great loaction close to the trendiest parts of Manhattan, than this is it, it you want more money to spend shopping and eating out, than this is it., if you want a comfortable clean room with private bathroom and good service, than this is it. The Cosmopolitan is everything you want for a fabulous time in Manhattan, 10 minute walk to Soho, Greenwich, 10 minute subway ride to Times Square, Empire State etc... perfect loctation, City Hall down the road, rasy walk to Brooklyn Bridge, 5 minute walk to Ground Zero and New York's best kept secret Century 21, designer discount department store, and one of the best little cafe's right under the hotel Cosmoplolitan Cafe which has an old Victorian feel, very cosy and initimate, good home style food, great service, and has all day breakfasts, and a secret room for special occasions. Drop in any time for a bite to eat. We loved it and almost ate their almost every day, and we stayed 14 nights. Our fiirst time in New York from Sydney Austalia and would stay and eat here again! The only thing that takes a little getting used to is the noise from the street, but everything else was perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and value”
Reviews.Author: roberta91
Reviews.Content: Things I love about the Cosmopolitan: Cleanliness, and a certain spare charm to the rooms Price -very reasonable Location - near subway stations Starbucks, a wonderful Deli/Market with ATM, and a lovely bistro in the same building At any moment, you can hear several different languages being spoken - one of the reasons I love New York Friendly staff! I have stayed there several times and it never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Wahaay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for anyone wanting a clean and friendly hotel in a great location in Manhattan. Rooms are small but the use of space is clever - we had a double bedroom with TV and a separate room with sofa, desk and TV which is ideal when your partner is a light sleeper and wakes up early. The hotel is in a great area - the subway connecting to the JFK Air-Train is only at the end of the block - and the ground floor has a Starbucks, cafÃ©, and shops. Staff are efficient and friendly - after I left the hotel I contacted them about an MP3 player left in the room safe and Josh on the front desk had it located and Fedexed to me without charge. Free wi-fi is a positive bonus and a good example to other,fancier hotels charging much higher prices but still ripping people off by charging for wi-fi. Overall we found the hotel excellent value for money and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting NYC with or without a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, beware the loft rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SFPL
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here 10 years ago and loved it, so we wanted to return. The staff were fantastic this stay. Even better than before. Our room was immaculate each day after the maid service. We had booked the mini-loft, but found it way too cramped and uncomfortable to spend more than one night in. We were cheerfully moved to a regular room with one double bed the next morning at no extra cost. Then we realized that we'd left a phone charger in the first room. It was happily delivered to our room after being located in lost and found. Our new room faced West Broadway and it was noisy, but I enjoyed the view of the street, and with ear plugs I slept fine. We ate breakfast nearly every morning at the Cosmopolitan Cafe. The food is great and extremely reasonably priced for Manhattan! Great service here as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SBSglenmills
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my colleagues while attending a trade show in the city. We found this hotel to be a perfect fit for our needs. Easy to get to from the Holland Tunnel, very clean, and a very good value for NYC. Parking is just around the corner and the hotel price for the parking lot is only $35 for 24 hours. That's cheaper than most hotels charge for 1/2 day (I had to pay $45 for 4 hours at the trade show hotel)! There is a Starbucks just outside the front entrance and a great new bar that openend up across the street. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would choose this hotel any time I am returning for business or for a weekend getaway too!

Reviews.Title: “A rare gem in New York City”
Reviews.Author: nicolelow
Reviews.Content: The Cosmo is smack in the middle of hip Tribeca, with the subway station just a couple of feet from the front door. The room were typically small but very clean and well maintained. Bathroom was immaculate as well but also tiny. The airconditioner was very loud but that meant it blocked out all the street noise. There was no iron in the room but you could ring reception for one (no charge). Service was friendly and when we asked where the subway was, one of the staff actually walked us out to the street. In New York City, who would've guessed? Felt very safe in the area, even at night. Location couldn't have been better. We walked to Wall St and the subway took us all the way to the Upper West Side, Times Square etc. Housing Works (secondhand designer store with proceeds going to charity) was just next door and the area is dotted with awesome and cheap food carts. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and needs updating”
Reviews.Author: PaulM5485
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel online some five weeks prior to our arrival, my Guest Request asked for a room "Preferably with a good view of West Broadway please". What we got was an internal room with a window overlooking the central air-shaft. No window of the street. Because of this, our room was very dark at all times of the day and not great when you're trying to recover from jet lag. We requested a different 'brighter' room but all they had was a tiny, tiny room which didn't even have space of store a suitcase. Checking in was no pleasurable experience either. The staff member was in a deep conversation with another other staff member and his only words to us throughout check-in was "room 227 second floor". That was it. No decent welcome. The rooms and corridors need modernising. The lobby was modern but once you go upstairs, the decor goes down! The room was clean, though my wife did find a pubic hair on her "clean" towel. The location was good, with a subway station outside the front door. The hotel had free wi-fi but the strength was so weak that my wife's iphone could just connect but my blackberry could not. There are better hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: nmers
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed here Labor Day weekend 2010, and we were all very happy with the decision! The price was perfect, and so was everything else. The staff was very friendly and happy to help us. The location was convenient - Starbucks, convenience store, cafe, and restaurant on the same corner, and access to the 1, 2, and 3 subway lines. The only minor complaint was the noise level outside, but that's normal in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but rooms were small”
Reviews.Author: LarssonDK
Reviews.Content: Was staying at this hotel for 3 nights. It is a very basic hotel with nothing special. I was traveling in a larger group of family members and we had 3 different rooms. There was a great difference in the way the rooms were arranged, but all were very small. The interior was old, and there was issues with all the bathrooms but these were fixed during our stay. The air conditioning is integrated in the window frame, and was very noisy. We had to turn it off during the night. If you don't expect much but a place to sleep, this could be a good basic hotel for a sightseeing and shopping trip to New York. The service from the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem at a great price”
Reviews.Author: didder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend and it was great! The staff was very friendly and attentive and the location is perfect. Right next to a subway and it's a great area of NYC. Now with the bed bug problem in NYC we were worried but everything was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The only complaint I had was that my 6'4" husband had to duck and walk in sideways into the very small bathroom. Was not a huge deal because it was actually pretty funny. I will definitely stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, well located and clean - just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Plum2Go
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel (travelling with my teenage daughter) based on TripAdvisor reviews and because I wanted a hotel that wasn't in the middle of skyscrapers. It fulfilled all my criteria. We had a cheap and easy journey from JFK on the AirTrain and A train to Chambers St, one block from the hotel. As the hotel is an older building the rooms are variable in size and views from the window but we struck lucky and got a corner room with a view of trees at the front and the Empire State Building at the side. The room was quite big, the bathroom small but well laid out (which could do with hooks for clothes/wet towels - my only recommendation for improvement). Air conditioner was below the window in the wall and made a quiet and constant rather than variable noise which helped mask the sound of traffic. We stayed for seven nights & the room and bathroom were thoroughly cleaned every day. Bedlinen and towels were also changed. This is a 'budget' hotel in that extra facilities (room service, ice etc) aren't provided, but it is top class in terms of comfort. The desk staff were always friendly. Secure storage of our cases (with a claim check) was provided on our check-out day. I left an item in our room and didn't realise for four days. They had retained the item and arranged to send it to me. This is an excellent hotel in an excellent location if you want to be in a 'neighbourhood' where New Yorkers live, eat and shop. As well as all the local facilities mentioned in previous reviews there's a riverside park four blocks to the west where you can walk down to Battery Park; a welcome break from hot days of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and the staff could not have been nicer!!”
Reviews.Author: Monib34
Reviews.Content: A cousin and I stayed for a week at the Cosmpolitan and loved every minute of it. I will definitely stay there next time I am in New York. The location is great. You are in a neighborhood setting away from the rush of the city. The people at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. The Cosmopolitan Cafe next door is fabulous. And there is a tiny store that has everything you could possibly need. There are many restaurants and shops in the immediate area. A great greek pick up place around the corner called Baba Ganouch and a restaurant/bar across the street named Mudville. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. I have already recommended the hotel to friends who will be traveling to New York in the next few months. I cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: suomeli
Reviews.Content: Tribeca was a great location to stay and this hotel was an ok choice. First we got a smoking room even though we had ordered a non smoking room. But we could change without problem. The rooms are tiny and the street next to it noisy all night around so if you are a bad sleeper you won't find a good night sleep here. The bed was under the roof accessible through a small stairladder, which was very difficult for a family with a small baby.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: ThK2010
Reviews.Content: Cosmopolitan Hotel is located very centrally in Manhattan, directly at subway station Chambers St. Rooms are small for two, but clean and with fan and HDTV. Noisy streets as everywhere in Manhattan. Friendly staff. Very recommendable for a short stay. Easy to find and good connection to/from airports (JFK and Newark).

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: thomik80
Reviews.Content: - location is ok - rooms and bathrooms are very small - air con is integrated in the window, which does not close correctly -> nearly unpossible to sleap there - very unflexible service at the front desk - no restaurant, bar etc. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pesh123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in large room for 5 people with spouse & 2 teenage daughters - faculties were great for the value and location very good to get around NY subway

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: LmacP
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The room was small but that was expected. We had a double bed with a love seat that converted into a pull out. It was very clean. The service was exceptional, always warm and friendly. The MTA was at our door step as was the Cosmopolitan Cafe which had excellent food, frozen yogurt and coffee. A movie was being filmed up the street which was exciting. The view was great. Although you could get an ally view if you wanted less street noise. My only complaints are the slow elevator and loud window unit air conditioner. BUt you could take the stairs and turn off the air conditioner so those annoyances could be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, away from the tourist hubbub and easy walking to nice quiet neighborhoods, Brooklyn bridge, etc.”
Reviews.Author: KLW_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Not having been to NYC in many years, I had no idea what to expect for $200 a night... So I was actually pleasantly surprised (having prepared myself for getting much less than I'm used to for my money in such an expensive place...). The lobby is small, but clean and nice. Has maps, brochures, a few chairs, but no bathrooms or much else really. The room was clean, pleasant, quiet enough. No closet but an armoire in the corner, a desk with a mirror, and a nightstand. Window unit A/C was loud but kept the room plenty cold on a hot weekend. There was also a ceiling fan and decent flat screen tv which we didn't watch. The bathroom was fine too -- just a tiny shelf to put things on and no hooks to hang anything, but otherwise fine. The location was good in that it was right by a subway stop, easy to get a cab, some restaurants nearby and away from the touristy hubbub of midtown... We liked being able to get away from the crowds, walk to Soho, West Village, Greenwich Village, etc. easily from the hotel. There is only one elevator and it's very slow, so patience or a tolerance for stair-climbing is a necessity... I would probably try someplace else next time just because there are so many options in NY, but I was not at all unhappy or disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: Location is great, cute neighborhood and by the subway. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AplmaCruiser
Reviews.Content: Tribeca is one happening area! Unless you're a hopeless snob in need of elegance and frills, you should find this great little hotel to be perfectly adequate. Cosmo is a great place for an overnighter, if you fly in the day prior to your cruise out of Red Hook. If you speak Spanish, you'll be right at home here, since all the staff habla Espanol -the place is owned by a family from Honduras. Eating places abound in the area, as do small shops and quality-foods markets and supermarkets. The N.E. exit to the Chambers St. subway stop is right on their sidewalk, next to the Starbucks shop -plus there's a newsstand, a nice little Cosmo Cafe and a tiny convenience store(open from 6 until 2 a.m.)...all within about 30ft. of the hotel's entrance We met people from all over the world staying there! You'll see more of my photos of the area and the hotel, via Panoramio -on Google Earth

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ritsis
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to this hotel and once again I was not disappointed. The hotel was clean, and our room was very clean and nicely appointed. Location is perfect. It is close to everything by foot or subway. Stepping outside you really feel like a New Yorker instead of a tourist. Street traffic can be somewhat noisey but far less than the middle of Time Square. The Staff is great! So Friendly and helpful, they seem to have the answers to any possible concern or question. I will keep coming back to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ncmom51
Reviews.Content: This older hotel is in the perfect location for seeing the sights of New York. It is in walking distance to Ground Zero and the ferries to the Statue of Liberty. Across the street is the 123 subway and around the corner is the ABC subway. The hotel room was small but we required 2 double beds and this was one of the few hotels that offered it at a rate we could afford. We only slept and showered in the room so it was perfect for us. Few amenities (I never could find any ice) but the staff was very friendly and brought extra pillow and towels up for us. The elevator is quite small (it only holds 6) The staff was extremely nice to my family. They let us check in early and were very friendly. There is a great real New York diner around the corner as well as a market just down the street a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in TriBeCa”
Reviews.Author: courcellesqc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmopolitan for a weekend in NYC. It's well located in TriBeCa, Chambers subway station is right in front of the hotel. Our room was clean and had a good size but the bathroom was small. Staff was nice and helpful. On the negative side, there's only one small and slow elevator, it's faster to use the stairs. There was a strong moth balls smell in the corridor leading to our room, and on the first day, the maid forgot to make the room, we had to ask for it but it was taken care of quickly. As for the noise, the hotel is located on a busy corner (West Broadway/Chambers) so you hear traffic noise from early in the morning but it was OK to sleep during the night. Overall, this is a good budget option, a room in TriBeCa close to SoHo for under 200$

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled and never got my money back!”
Reviews.Author: Fabd69
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to going to NY for the Easter weekend from Montreal...and sadly I lost my job so decided to cancel NY one month before that weekend...and 6 weeks later I still didn't get my money back and they never anwered my e-mails...so I went straight to MasterCard and they are taking care of it!!! Sorry but be carefull if you go there don't cancel cause you won't see your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ Cosmopolitan historical hotel - Tribecca”
Reviews.Author: Moila
Reviews.Content: We went to New York last month for celebrating Easter. It was my very first visit to NY.. and so glad that we stayed at Cosmopolitan :). Hubby booked straight to hotel, it was said to be the very first hotel built in hotel. 45 minutes ride through subway from JFK, then from Chamber st station only couple steps away then voila! ..Small hotel downtown TRibecca, great location, small hotel, room was remodeled, clean, helpful staff at front desk. We got 'loft style' room that is cute with bath room/sofa/tv downstair & bedroom upstair (yes with tv). The room was 'old style' with narrow window, a glimpse of what old NY feels like. The lift could be quite slow but hey we only @ second floor, so it was much faster just walked down the stairs. Hotel didn't offered b'fast, but who need it when there is a coffee shop next to hotel, that offered heavenly french toast/yogurt parfait. There are surrounding businesses: barber shop (m'darling hubby got his hair cut there), coffee shop next to hotel, that offered heavenly french toast/yogurt parfait, and 24 hrs mini market. There are ton's of eatery places @ Manhattan: Starbuck , Mexican restaurant, at the other corner, Italian, Burger style coffee shop u name it! very accessible, & bustling down town. Basically we're out all day & went back at the hotel at night, just like the local does! .. We're going back to NYC next time & will definitely recommend Cosmopolitan :)

Reviews.Title: “Two desk clerks were rude and obnoxious.. rooms small - not soundproof”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: There are two desk clerks who are rude and obnoxious. I checked in about 11:30pm and got to my room ( a loft). The a/c didn't work so I called the desk clerk, he said to turn on the switch on the wall and if it still didn't work to call back. It still didn't work so he said he'd send someone up. Nobody came so I decided to go down with my luggage and ask for another room. He seemed like he didn't want to move me, never apologized and tried to call maintenance a couple times, even though I asked for another room. The next day I left by 9am and got back about 3:30pm and despite the maid service sign being out my room wasn't cleaned. I called the front desk and the same rude desk clerk wanted to send up the maid then. I asked if they could come after 5:30pm and his only answer the maids leave at 5pm. When I asked again can they come after 530 he said ok, but when I asked why he said they leave at 5pm, he just said they leave at 5pm. I went downstairs to sit in the lobby and wait and after awhile I asked the rude woman at the desk if the maides were done, she said she'll call to send one up. When I threatened to look for another hotel - she said go ahead there is one across the street - not helpful, no apology nothing. Pros: free wifi, location - near multiple several subway lines. One right outside the door and another a block away. A few blocks away from the trade center site. Cons: Don't get a loft room - The loft has a double bed and tv - you cannot stand up straight, very hot up there and the bed was uncomfortable. I ended up sleeping on the pull out single bed from the chair because it was more comfortable and much cooler. On the lower level and luckily there was another tv down there. Noisy to the outside - window a/c so the soundproofing to the outside was horrible. These two desk clerks were rude and obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff At this hotel and no phone service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Banna1981
Reviews.Content: The people working at this hotel are very unfriendly and at times downright rude. I don't expect to be greeted with cheery, happy faces but I certainly didn't expect to be greeted with curt answers and people that seemed like checking me in was such a hassle. after my stay, I called to figure out a discrepancy in the credit card charges. The first time I called I was hung up while I was being transferred to the office. I called back immediately and did not get an apology or anything for the hang up. Then I was transferred to two other people before I got the person in charge. I finally got to the boss in charge who practically yelled at me over the phone. The loft at the hotel wasn't too bad but clearly not made for taller people (I am 6'0 and had to stoop down a bit whenever I was in the loft. This place did have free wifi, but you may have a lot of trouble if you have AT&T. My phone barely worked while I was in my room...I had to go out in the hallway. Needless to say I had no desire to stay at this place ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best.”
Reviews.Author: big-blue-eyes
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay here at the Cosmopolitan and it is still the best hotel for me. What can I say that I haven't said before? The reception staff are helpful, as ever and the rooms are kept spotless. I stayed in a double room this trip rather than a two bed room as I was with my husband for our anniversary. The room was at the back of the hotel, so no view, but large enough for our needs. It is so easy to get every where you want to go to in New York from here as the subway is directly underneath. I really like the area, less hustle and bustle of Midtown and there are plenty of places to eat close by. The Bouley bakery just up and across the street was great for food any time. It has altered since my last visit into a larger store with hot food as well as baked goods and delightful cakes! You can take your purchases into a very comfortable room along side the store and sit and eat. There were lots of locals in there so it did seem a popular spot with everyone. A very pleasant place to sit and have a coffee or what ever you want. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants good value and doesn't mind being a little out of the busyness of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure in NYC”
Reviews.Author: spopod
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Hotel was wonderful. The hotel was so convenient to shopping and restaurants. The subway stop across the street made it so simple to head uptown for the theater and musuems. The staff was very efficient and most helpful. You can't beat the Cosmopolitan for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, fun room.”
Reviews.Author: Joexray
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a 36 hour "guerilla" weekend trip, just a back pack and our clothes and needed a LOW COST no frills place for one night. Good reasonable rate for NY, clean room,loft bed was fun, good location

Reviews.Title: “Great quit location”
Reviews.Author: enzfrnz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently redone and looked modern and in good shape. The rooms were small, but comfortable. The hotel staff were not very friendly and I did not get the free breakfast I was due with my stay. It was a good deal for the price and right outside was the Chambers Street subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.. but Beware the Red Head Desk Clerk..”
Reviews.Author: Chao_sweetie
Reviews.Content: Problem : I booked this for a Solo New Years Eve trip from December 30-Jan. 03 2010. I booked the hotel and was given a quote of $849 for my stay. However when I got there the Desk clerk (she had an accent and was red haired) Checked me In... This is were the problem started. She told me the room was $950. I pulled out the confirmation and the names of the guys, I spoke to three times confirming the price. I even called before I got on the plane and they confirmed the price was $849. She cut me off but told me she can lower it to $915. Here I am in a city I never been to by myself with no family. I had no choice but to take the room. I told her, I would hand this at check out when I had to pay. Solution : When I checked out, I spoke to the gentleman at the front desk. Told him what happened he apologized and he told me I only owed $829 . He stated he had no idea where the $915 or $950 came from. I didn't argue since he fixed the problem and gave me an additional discount for my trouble. I recommend the male Spanish desk clerks.. Stay away from the red head. Room : Clean but Small. I had the Bed with the sleeper sofa. Two people max for the small space. Shower was nice size and clean. The housekeepers were very diligent about the cleaning.. However, the window in my room fell out of the tracks when I closed the curtain.. Luckily I caught it.. and placed it back.. but all in all it was a good room and they kept the temp. setting warm and comfortable. Location : The location was great. The Subway was right next door. So you can take the 1,2or 3 train uptown. It was a good location. And Canal Street was very close. Great shopping. (Haggle at Canal Street at Night... give a sob story to the street merchants for a good discount. I told one my grandfather need a watch, he tried to sale it to me for $200 .. he gave it to me for $11 after I hit him with the puppy dog eyes..) Value : This was the cheapest I could find for NYC in New Years. I just hopped on the 1 train to time square about 2:00pm and stayed in Times Square til 2:00am. The area is busy and well lit so when I got home exhausted and in bad need to use the bathroom. The hotel was a warm blessing .

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeGurl72
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice...Have suggested it to numerous people. The rooms are small but clean. No fancy amenities but goodness, you are in New York City people. Why would you want to hang out in your room? The location is perfect with the subway station right outside the door. We used it for our hub to go up and down Manhattan. Now planning my third trip to NYC and of course, will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and top position”
Reviews.Author: Ric1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 weeks and found the hotel ideally situated to get on any subway line. The rooms were not too small and it was great having free wifi for our ipod touch's to check weather etc. The bed was tiny but I had booked a room with a sofa and we alternated sleeping in it and the bed so we could stretch out (highly recommended) We were on the 4th floor right on the corner so we had a lot of noise from cars and especially cop cars honking at the intersection. Make sure you bring ear plugs, especially in the summer, however the noise in Tribeca was nothing as you moved towards Times square and fine with ear plugs. The hotel turned out to be better than I expected as there were a number of negative reviews on this site, but coupled with its position to the subways the local restaurants and bars, plus the cost I would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gman1868
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Tribeca. It was everything we hoped for and more! The highlights of our stay included a cozy but clean room, a very acommodating and professional staff, easy access to the subway, a short distance to many fine restaurants, and the best cafe right next door. The staff was available 24x7 to take care of what we needed, and their recommendations were always helpful. We appreciated the care they took to store our luggage while out on the town and arranging for a car to take us to the airport. The subway right outside the front door can wisk you up to Times Square or down to the Financial District. Walk one block over you can board the "A" train to Central Park. Whether you prefer to eat nearby or take a ride uptown, the staff had many good suggestions on places to eat depending upon what we were interested in, and the cafe next door can't be beat for breakfast. We cant say there was anything we liked the least, it was all good!

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: GratefulCosmoGuest
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Hotel has been my home away from home for over ten years during which I have had the pleasure of being a guest nearly every week for perhaps three nights on average. During that time I have told many people that unless they are looking for a luxury hotel, the Cosmo is the place to stay. You will not find a cleaner or better maintained place. All facilities and furniture are spotless and in excellent condition (not just the lobby like many other places). Because the Cosmo is a small hotel, during my time there I have had the pleasure of meeting and coming to know just about everyone who works there - the manager, office staff, front desk staff, housekeeping staff and maintenance staff. All are very good at what they do but more importantly all are polite, friendly, helpful and trustworthy. And you get all of this at a remarkably affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Cutie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmo for 3 nights with 3 of my girlfriends! We absolutely loved it! Mind you. There was 4 of us, and the room is very tiny! We had a two bedroom and there isnt room for much else! 4 girls in New York and their luggage...you can imagine how tight it was! But it doesnt matter, your in New York City, in a great location. Really great breakfast place nearby, and the best part? The subway is literally steps from the front door! You can get to anywhere super fast! We all felt really safe there, and the staff was nice, and didnt bother us at all, even though we were loud some nights! :) The only thing we didnt like about this hotel was the water pressure from the shower. It felt like you were being beaten haha but other than that, there are zero complaints! :)

Reviews.Title: “most reasonable rates in nyc”
Reviews.Author: citycat99
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel my boyfriend and I tell our family and friends to stay at when they're visiting. It's close to everything and very clean and modern for the price. Best deal by far compared to all other hotels in the area (East Village, West Village, Lower East side etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal after all”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: Space and confortabilitty hava e different meaning while youÂ´re in NYC. With that tought in mind, enjoy the 'out-of-Manhattan-rates", the clean and cozy rooms, the subway lines few steps aways and all cafes & shops Tribeca area offers. But donÂ´t bring too much luggage,,,

Reviews.Title: “The Cosmopolitan is a pristine hotel located in Tribeca with easy access to the remainder of Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen_9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Cosmopolitan a half a dozen times and have never been disappointed. The rooms and the entire hotel are pristine. We often use the stairs, and they are spotless. The rooms can be a bit small, but most of our time is spent out exploring and enjoying the city. You can catch the subway from any of the four corners. The Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown, and the Hudson are blocks away. Excellent restaurants are found in every block. Staff at the Cosmopolitan are always helpful and confident in their jobs. We will continue to make this our "home" for future NY visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tobag0
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location just next to underground station with new clean rooms. Friendly staff and free internet. There's a Starbucks right next to the hotel so the morning coffee is guaranteed. We are definitely coming again when traveling to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lmoffi
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights/5 days for a girls trip in NYC. We found the hotel room clean and efficient. The hotel is well situated downtown extremely close to several subway lines.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy + Quaint”
Reviews.Author: EMA375
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Tribeca NYC. It was a last minute booking and was on a tight budget. The accommodations were modest and view was null, but we spent very little time in our spacious room. The location was PERFECT! Right around the corner from the subway and a fantastic little bagel shop, Zucker's.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in on place!”
Reviews.Author: kariloca
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Cosmopolitan Hotel! The service was excellent!!! Every request we asked for was granted in no time! and everyone working there was very nice. The rooms and the bathrooms are a little small but very nice and cozy. The location could not be more convenient!! The subway station is two steps away, Starbucks and a small convenient store (that has everything you need) are on the right side. And on the left side you have a really nice Mexican restaurant!!!... Not to mention all the stores and places to eat all around the area (walking distance). I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I visit the Big Apple!!.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Travelertoo_Texas
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. The room was so small the sink could not fit in the bathroom. You could lie in bed and control the televison with your toes were it not for the fact that the tv had to be installed on a hospital style wall stand since there was no place to put it elsewhere in the room. In order to watch the tv you had to lie down on the bed or suffer through a neck strain from looking up. There was basically no room to sit anywhere but on the bed. Window air conditioner worked fine, but noisy. Cost was no bargain. We stayed the previous weekend at the Millenium UN (a great hotel, by the way) for much less than the weekend night we stayed at the Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “The location and price are the only thing that saves this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_teacher23
Reviews.Content: I really like to look for a bargain (without compromising) and so reading the reviews on here thought that this would be a good place to stay. Fortunately, we got quite a good deal for 4 nights through Expedia however, I wonder if this was reflected in the rooms we were given. The first room (520) was so tiny that my face was about 6 inches from the air conditioner unit when lying in bed, plus my other half could lay on the bed and touch both walls! The hotel begrudingly moved us to another room, this was much more spacious but, again had really noisy aircon - not great, that added with the four units outside the window from another block. We were on the top floor and the elevatior took ages to move too! Yes, the location is great (one of the main reasons for our choice) we didn't break the bank staying here, but I am certain that there are far far better places to stay, choose this hotel, if you can't find another deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DC1969
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Hotel is quaint, clean and comfortable without feeling cramped, like most boutique hotels in New York City. The room was pristine and well furnished, and the beds were large and comfortable. The location of the hotel is great for both business and pleasure as it is only a short walk from Wall Street and and located in the heart of Tri-Beca, and close Greenwich Village. Great bang for the buck. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manuel5050
Reviews.Content: I am self employed and â€œhaveâ€� travel to Manhattan of business regularly. I picked this hotel on price and reviews I found on online. Stayed there and found the hotel to be unpretentious and spotlessly clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions where to eat around the area. Unlike midtown (touristy and way overpriced) I found very good eateries. In closing â€“ this is a GREAT value. I will stay there again. This is the 1st time I have been moved to make a review. Have read them before, but never wrote one.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: muerachavez2002
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for several days. The location was not too bad- close to WTC site, Chinatown and SoHo, and a short subway ride from Midtown. The rooms were small, but the ceilings were high, so you don't feel too cramped. Our room was always clean and had been recently remodeled, or so it appeared. It faced Chambers St., and was noisy - awoke a couple times per night from noise from trucks and such. Air conditioner also is noisy, though there is a ceiling fan to use instead. Rooms facing another direction may be less noisy. Staff was generally helpful and courteous, with few exceptions. There are many eating places nearby, as well as a riverfront park and shopping. i recommend the old-fashioned cafe on Chambers Street next to the hotel. Overall, the Cosmopolitan was a good, less-expensive alternative to the pricier places in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure Yet Again to stay at the Cosmopolitan !!”
Reviews.Author: LAbuzyexec
Reviews.Content: The staff remembers my name every time I come. Marcela at the front desk is always very helpful and pleasant to deal with. I hope the General manager of the hotel reads this. The front desk staff always gets me on a room away from the noise so I can do my work on the laptop.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: Sethz
Reviews.Content: Traveling to NYC is complicated. Many of the chain hotels offer this and that always at a cost. I've recently stayed at a place which offers clean rooms at an affordable price: the cosmopolitan. The location can't be beat, the heart of trbeca. Just to put the cherry on the top, the staff is very pleasant. So, if what you're looking for is a cheap room that's safe and clean with a great location and a nice staff, than I highly recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY- WORKERS GO IN YOUR ROOM & TAKE YOUR STUFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: industryintel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, and we were traveling through NY on our way back from a trip through Europe. We had won the trip, and were ecstatic. On our trip, we bought souveneirs, one of which was extremely antique and expensive. On the night that we stayed at The Cosmopolitan, we went out for dinner. Before dinner, we were looking at our souveneirs, particularly the expensive one, and we set it out on the table. We then left our room (doors automatically lock), and we double checked. When we returned from dinner, the souveneir was gone. We searched the room high and low, and then went to report it to management. On our way there, we noticed many workers (maids, cleaning crew, both men & women) in our hallway. We approached the front desk, and asked the manager who had access to our rooms. He said everyone did, and we told him about the theft. He just stared back blankly and said "well, file a police report". I stared at him stunned. He didn't care at all! He didn't even have any regard for the incident. I was infuriated. It ruined our trip. Obviously the police could care less about a stolen souvenier, but to us it was horrific. You expect to have your room safe. And you expect management to care!!! STAY AWAY FROM THE HOTEL, unless you want your stuff stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Not expensive and not so good”
Reviews.Author: J1966
Reviews.Content: I shouldn't complain as I looked for a low price hotel in a city with ridiculous high prices. Price, expectations and delivery were all in line with each other. Hotel is very basic, it's clean and rooms are small. Neighborhood is lovely and hotel a good starting point to see the other side of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great price, Small room...”
Reviews.Author: Gailia
Reviews.Content: My hubbie and I stayed in this hotel for three nights. The location is great if you are in to staying near the village, soho and chinatown, but you cant really afford it... The price is relativly fare. There is a subway station right next to the entrance of the lobby. Although the room for two is tiney, it is modern designed, and very clean, with a nice LCD hanging above the bed. The only problem we had was the noisy air-con, but as there is a cielling fan, it wasn't a serious problem. We asked to check out later, they did not make an issue out of it, and did not charge extra. There is a nice starbucks right next to the entrance (from W broadway) and a vey nice cosmo cafe' for a plesant breakfast. next to the chambers st entrance there is a nice cafe' too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent basic hotel for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: schmatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for business. Just your standard, basic NYC hotel. Small rooms but clean, good location for all of the lower Manhattan attractions. It's a bit older property but you can't beat the price. Literally right above one of the main subway lines so very convenient in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirlsWeekender
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC with my two adult daughters, one of whom lives in Brooklyn. We have been trying out different hotels in different areas, visiting several times a year. Cosmopolitan is very nice. Clean, friendly staff, convenient location. Soda shop around the corner was fantastic! Old fashioned ice cream shop. Subway is right across the street. Good value for NYC. Maryann's mexican restaurant on the same block was excellent. We sat outside on a nice summer night. (not many this year so far). Pitchers of margaritas, mole sauce! Planning on returning for my birthday weekend in December.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished hotel of humble character. Perfect for low key travel”
Reviews.Author: rn4trips124
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my 20-something daughter; we were in NYC looking at schools and visiting friends. This is a great area of NYC, especially in the summer months. Last time we were in NYC we stayed across the street at Smyth (Thompson Hotel) and I noted the Cosmopolitan nearby. I was having a lot of difficulty finding a hotel in my price range for our dates, but happened to see this hotel on Quikbook for a good rate, checked out the reviews here on TA and booked it based on my knowledge of the area and the TA reviews. We were VERY pleasantly surprsed with this hotel. Very clean hotel, very good front desk service. Our room was spacious, inviting and immaculate! We had a room with 2 double beds on the 3rd floor facing West Broadway. We found the room to be well lit and pretty darn quiet (very little noticable traffic noise and no excessive air conditioner noise as mentioned by previous posters). This is a nicely refurbished old hotel of humble character. There is no real lobby, no bar, and no eating establishment in the hotel but all manner of food and drink are steps away. It is not a business or conference hotel but is perfect for low-key leisure travel. I found this hotel to be a very good value and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: supermom1976
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NYC via megabus.com near penn station, hoped on the number 1 train downtown and got off at the chamber st station, came upto ground level and the hotel was literally right there(didn't even have to cross the street) - SUPER CONVENIENT AND EASY. Check in was a breeze. We stayed in a room with one queen bed , rooms are on the small side, but they are super clean, and it totally suits the purpose. You're not there to stay in your room. They are cleaned daily. There is a starbucks and a small cafe on the bottom floor of the hotel. There are also tons of reasonable priced restaurants surrounding the area. Tribeca is a beautiful area, so it was awesome to walk around and look at things. You are a 5 min walk to the World Trade Center Site, Century 21 is right across the street from there. For those of you not familiar with Century 21...think winners(canada) or TJ MAXX(U.S) but a MILLION times better and BIGGER. Awesome designer and brand name labels and GREAT prices. As mentioned earlier, the subway is right outside the front door and is a major line that will take u anywhere you want to go. Subway to Times Square is 7 mins, nowhere takes long to get to. We paid $125 u.s a night, which is an excellent price. I will definately stay here again, well worth the money and fabulous location

Reviews.Title: “A gem! I wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: David Howell
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this brilliant hotel for the last four years but have been keeping the secret beacuse I am selfish and don't want it to get so popular that I can't get a reservation. I cannot praise it enough. OK the rooms can be small but they are comfortable and hey, this is Manhattan and the rates are so reasonable. I have always found everything clean and tidy and well maintained. Most of the staff have been there since my very first visit and they are all very friendly and willing to help - and I mean all of them, whatever their job! If there is a problem in the room it is fixed immediately. There is no restaurant but the Cosmopolitan Cafe, next door, is brilliant, especially for breakfast and if you really must, there is Starbucks on the other side. Tribeca is full of a huge variety of wonderful restaurants and bars and great shopping is never very far away. I cannot recomment this hotel highly enough - I wouldn't stay anywhere else (unless they are full, of course)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: GO_BEAVERS_OHIO
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for travel around NYC! Staff extremely friendly, polite and helpful. Rooms are immaculate! I brought a group here for 7 nights - spacious for everyone. Have been coming here for years and will continue to make this my first and only hotel in NYC! Great value!

Reviews.Title: “A bit hot!”
Reviews.Author: LadyBManchester
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right next to subway stops and within walking distance of restaurants, bars and some sights. It was also very good value for Manhattan. We had one of the loft rooms with a sleeping deck above the living area/ bathroom. The room was quite narrow but there was plenty of space for two with luggage. The room faced an internal courtyard so there was no street noise but also no view. Only complaints were that the air-conditioning was noisy and the room (and corridors) were really hot and we visited in April. Overall it's a good option so long as you don't visit at the height of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Traviata5013
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here because it was near lower Manhattan. It's a very simple hotel, clean, well-located, and basically a business hotel as it's near the financial district. The room was fine, but the a.c. was extremely noisy. I could hear doors slamming down the hallway late at night which was a little daunting. But the main feature is the price. Where else can you get a hotel with private bath at the rates other hotels in NYC charge? The best thing about the hotel is the little French cafÃ© located on the main floor, just off the lobby. The food and service were excellent. I'd go back to the place just to eat at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best "big city" hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jeminlondon
Reviews.Content: My husband, friend & I arrived around midnight at the hotel, expecting problems as we were so late. Not at all, the reception staff were very polite & helpful and showed us to our room. The free Wi-Fi was an excellent perk. Rooms were clean & tidy (and large for NYC!), only problem was that the toilet did not flush. Not a problem for the very capable housekeeping staff, it was fixed within an hour of us mentioning it to reception. Proximity to subway was fantastic, just walk out the door and there it is. It took about 5 mins on Express train to get to Times Square. It's also a very nice walking area, especially along W. Broadway up town. It's extremly close to WTC area and Wall Street if you are interested in that type of sightseeing. I would stay here again & would recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in new york city”
Reviews.Author: sashamaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awsome it was the cleanest hotel i have ever stayed in. The front desk clerks were really helpful and nice people. The location was perfect it was walking distance from China Town,Little Italy,Bars,Clubs,and all kinds of restruants,also Jamba Juice was across the street. I was nervous when I booked here because I found it myself on line and read the reviews but it is still makes you nervous not knowing the area and first time there. When we go back this is the only hotel we will stay in. You cant beat the prices and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: M4RKM
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay this time at the Cosmo, as I stayed at a different hotel for the best part of a week. However, I have to say, I probably won't stray away from this hotel. Checked in shortly after 11am, and my room was ready, and got a nice upgrade to a room that was bigger, street view (which i prefer, as noise does NOT bother me). Ice delivered to my room which is always nice, and friendly staff, who looked after my luggage for no charge for about 6 hours, while i did some shopping, and had lunch before departed to the airport. I've reviewed this hotel before, but keep coming back to the same place, and it's kinda nice that nothing changes about it, I know what to expect, and it's always a great stay. The area it is in, makes it probably one of the best hotels in NYC in my opinion. I stayed midtown east earlier the same week, and there really isn't much around there, apart from hotels, and more hotels, and overpriced restaurants, attached to hotels... the beauty about the corner of Chambers and W Broadway is that you have mudville 9 across the road for food and beers, and just a block away on Reade St, you have the Reade Street Bar & Kitchen, for much the same. Also, Morgans Deli is a great place for breakfast, just grab it, and head back to your room.. Excellent stay and can't wait til my next stay there in September!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: oneshortday
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend and what a find. The rooms were kinda small but that is expected in NYC. The bed had about a foot of space left over at the foot of it so the person on the side that was near the TV had to crawl over the person laying nearest to the bathroom. There was nowhere to walk around the bed. The shower was also made for someone who is 5'5" or smaller. I felt like a contortionist trying to take a shower. It was all good though. Great place and I will deff stay here again. Great location also. There's a subway right outside the door. Maybe 20 feet away from the entrance of the hotel. Nice neighborhood also. My only complaint was that the room was really hot but nothing that he ceiling fan didn't fix. It was also very clean which is a must for me in NYC. All in all it was a great stay at a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good service and great location”
Reviews.Author: frequentflying
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel. The rooms are very small but not to a level to become claustrophobic (and charmingly decorated). Internet access was for free and the staff had a great professional attitude. My flight out was in the afternoon the next day but they were able to keep my bags for me (very well managed, they will give you a numbered pickup ticket for it), this service was for free. The location is just great, so I think if I stay in NYC again I will almost certainly stay here again. They don't serve breakfast as far as I remember but there is a inexpensive Cafe/Restaurant just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location and room!”
Reviews.Author: branmoof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3-4 days in early June 2008. Great location! In Tribeca area, within walking distances to Wall Street, Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and Greenwich Village. Close to a subway.. red and blue line I think? But public transportation in NYC is fantastic, easily accessible and pretty simple to navigate once you get the hang of it. Small coffee shops, eateries, and 24hour convenience store located nearby too. And they have a cafe and a Starbucks on 1st floor of hotel. The room was small, but clean. Only complaint was that our washroom didn't have a fan/air ventilation/window, so got a bit steamy/damp after showers.. A/C was great as we ended up being in NYC during the heat wave last year. As there was construction during our stay, they accommodated our request for a room facing the back. Therefore, not much of a view, but no loud construction/car disturbances either. This may not be a problem anymore if construction is completed? Overall, great value for location and room; nothing fancy but you're in NYC to explore, not to stay in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the location”
Reviews.Author: VeniceCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The location was great right next to the subway entrances, and walking distance to some attractions. Didn't have a great view but we only slept in the room. We were to busy with New York. The room did get hot (central heating seems to be on most of the time), but we had an AC that fixed the temperature for us. I would definitely stay here again! We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights. They even let us check in earlier then planned. We got in early and our room was ready for us when we got there at 9am! Wonderful staff, clean room, and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location basic clean hotel but noisy and hot”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveller35
Reviews.Content: Great location - if you want to be in Tribeca - tube lines are very good and lots of nice restaurants in the area... Relative to other hotels this was very reasonably priced - we got by far the best deal through hotel connxions on line. Room was very clean but basic with small bathrooms. Rooms at the front of the hotel have insufficient double glazing for the street noise if you're not a heavy sleeper -cue axle grinders and taxi horns at 5am. Rooms were very hot during the night and not able to turn off the radiators as all controlled from a central boiler - hence the higher up the hotel you are the warmer it'll be. There is air conditioning but it's quite noisy so take ear plugs. My advise - opt for a room at the rear of the hotel which is quieter - how much do you really want a view of the street when you're out during the day and trying to sleep at night? Staff were friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GenbukaiTraveller
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Cosmo for a week and enjoyed it, except the elevator didn't always work and the noise from the street (if you facing Broadway) woke us up early. Great access to subway and very close to lower Manhattan sights such as Tribeca, Chinatown, Little Italy, Wall Street, and Ground Zero. Lots of good restaurants and bars around the area and seems very safe. Great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: Sabbydoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cosmopolitan for two nights in early December. We were not disappointed with the hotel -- it was exactly how I expected it to be. The hotel is in what I would consider an ideal location: far enough from the crazy crowds of midtown but in a cool area within steps of a subway station. It took us about 10-15 minutes on the subway to get to the shops on Fifth Ave, Macy's, Central Park, etc and you can walk to the Financial District, the Brooklyn Bridge, SoHo, and so on. The hotel is on a busy street but we did not have a street-facing room so the noise didn't bother us at all. There are plenty of cafÃ©s, restaurants and bars in the area. We arrived early in the day, and our room wasn't ready yet, but the staff stored our luggage for us until the afternoon. The room itself was very small with a teeny bathroom, but immaculately clean and nicely-decorated. For the price I would say it was a bargain for sure. The only thing I didn't enjoy was that the heat was blasting out of the radiator the whole time, making the room much too warm, but an open window solved that problem. Other than that it was perfect for our needs. This isn't the type of place you should go if you like amenities and service, but if you're just concerned with having a roof over your head, a comfy and clean bed and a great location, by all means this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: donna_da1
Reviews.Content: After searching online trying to find a nice hotel with in our price range we finaly settled on the cosmopolitan after being recommended to stay there by friends and thought it was great value for money. Ok so its hardly the lap of luxury the room was small, but you get what you pay for, and it was well kept, and how much time are really going to spend in your hotel room in New York. The staff were fine, they didnt really go out of their way to help you and just let you get on with it but they will hold your bags for you after check out. The subway was right outside the hotel very handy for getting around and there were two great little cafes on either side of the hotel plus a starbucks so all in all its a fine little hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Value plus in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GarryODay
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan Hotel is one of the few hotels in New York that you can book 12 months in advance. We booked on the recommendation of Fodors and Michelin Guides and the cost was more than competitive. After 3 previous trips to NYC my expectations of moderately priced hotels was not high. What a pleasant surprise! The place was absolutely spotless. We were in room 526 with 2 comfortable double beds. We had Wireless Internet free of charge, which over Christmas was a bonus talking to the family at home on Skype. If you demand a room with a view, large bathroom, room service and valet parking this hotel is not for you. What you save by not paying for these privileges you can use towards dinners and extra shows on Broadway. The maid service that we received was outstanding. As Australians, all we were requiring was fresh towels and sheets daily, and this is exactly what we received. The location of this hotel is superb. In the heart of Tribeca, this budget conscious hotel is 24 yards from the Subway entrance. Within walking distance are Wall Street, SoHo, The Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown and Little Italy. If you are low maintenance but demand cleanliness, this is you. The only service that we did require was laundry. Not to worry, we found West Broadway Cleaners at 81 W. Broadway that washes & folds for $1.50 per pound. Great service with no problems. This hotel also has the bonus of probably the best value cafÃ©/restaurant in Tribeca. The Cosmopolitan CafÃ© boasts a great breakfast menu plus a dinner menu that has daily specials with a wine service. All this is affordable to the average tourist. Uptown around Times Square we found most food outlets to be expensive fast food franchises, and we can get that in Cairns. We made it back to the hotel most nights after sightseeing to have dinner at the Cosmopolitan CafÃ©. If you are in New York for Christmas, I can highly recommend you have Christmas Dinner at the Cosmopolitan CafÃ©.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it...............”
Reviews.Author: lisah1984
Reviews.Content: Wow.......this is my fourth time to NYC and I have always stayed at the Pennsylvania House, however opted to stay at the Cosmopolitan this time (was sent a winter special rate online). It was the best thing I have ever done. My daughter and I stayed in the mini loft room in room 310, and even though the room was small, it was the perfet size for my 11 yr old and me. She thought the loft bed was the bomb. The #1 subway train was right outside of our front door and it was so easy to get to everything. The cafe beside of the hotel was fabulous, too. We will definately stay here again. I am already planning our next trip in the spring of 2009. The staff was soooooooo nice and helpful Loved it! Lisa and Shay

Reviews.Title: “affordable and clean NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: peachezz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a NYC resident as a place their family stays when they visit. All in all, a great hotel. My only complaint was a strong moth ball smell in the hallway on the 4th fl when you got off the elevator. Thankfully, our room didn't have the odor. The rooms were also very hot. There is no way of controlling heat in the room. Thankfully, the windows in the room and bathroom opened and there was an air conditioner. Room was definitely small, which is common for NY, but it was very clean. Noise wasn't an issue except for the screaming children next door who also proceeded to run through the hallways...grr! Subway is right around the corner and the Soda Shop downstairs has great food. Don't expect any frills. No ice or vending machines. There is a hair dryer though. Bathroom is small and there is very little counter space. Decor is simple, but nice. As Frommer's said, this place is great for a low maintenance traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: M1lla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Tribeca within short walking distance to Soho and Greenwich village bars and restaurants and shops. Rather small room with small beds. We were first given a amazingly small room on the fifth floor - with an view of the brick wall. The beed was very small, and after a short discussion with the staff we managed to find out that there are some rooms with queen beds and luckily we could switch room without problems. The new room on the third floor was larger, not spacious but I guess that's hard to find in NY, with a ok sized bed. The rooms was however facing westbroadway/chamber street which caused a lot of noice .- however if you value space in terms of room and bed size and not sleep to easily this is a better choice.
